Title: Data Scientist
Description:
¿Te apasiona la ciencia de datos y el desarrollo de soluciones analíticas? 👀




➥ Unirte a Innova, es formar parte de una empresa de consultoría líder a nivel nacional y en pleno desarrollo internacional. Si estás interesado en participar en proyectos innovadores de IA, Cloud Computing y Transformación Digital, creemos este es tu lugar. 🤝




En Innova-tsn buscamos incorporar profesionales con 3 años de experiencia en proyectos de ciencia de datos y modelización avanzada, para reforzar nuestro equipo en diferentes sectores como energía, retail, banca y más.




📌 ¿Qué buscamos?




Experiencia como Data Scientist de al menos 3 años en desarrollo y mantenimiento de modelos.
Conocimiento avanzado de técnicas de tratamiento y preparación de datos y analítica descriptiva.
Conocimiento del desarrollo, mantenimiento y monitorización de modelos de Machine Learning (Regresión, Clustering, XGBoost, Random Forest….) y técnicas de Forecasting.
Conocimiento avanzado de los lenguajes Python y R.
Estudios mínimos: Licenciatura/Grado en Matemáticas, Estadística, Ingeniería, Físicas, Económicas…




✅ ...es un plus!

Buen nivel en SAS y PySpark.
Perfil matemático con habilidades técnicas en el entorno de datos.




📈 ¿Qué valoramos?




Máster en Data Science, Machine Learning, Inteligencia Artificial.
Experiencia en Desarrollo de Redes Neuronales en frameworks como Keras, Pytorch, TensorFlow.
Conocimiento/experiencia de algoritmos de Optimización.
Experiencia en el desarrollo en entornos colaborativos (Github, Gitlab).
Experiencia en MLOps.
Conocimiento de LLMs: Técnicas de Prompt Engineering, RAG y Fine tuning.
·Experiencia /certificación en plataformas Cloud (AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud) tanto en el desarrollo como el despliegue de modelos.
Nivel avanzado de inglés.
Habilidad para trabajar en equipo y aportar en entornos colaborativos.




👋 ¿Qué te ofrecemos nosotros?




Contrato indefinido, invertimos y buscamos tu desarrollo a largo plazo.
Formaciones en plataformas e internas, y certificaciones oficiales a cargo de la empresa.
Planes de carrera personalizados, adaptados a tus fortalezas e intereses y basados en evaluaciones de desempeño anuales.
Beneficios sociales: seguro médico de cobertura completa.
Retribución flexible: ticket guardería y ticket restaurant.
Ser parte de un equipo especializado en soluciones empresariales y arquitectura de datos.




En Innova, fomentamos mucho el desarrollo del talento, la creatividad y el trabajo en equipo. Invertimos en espacios, tecnologías y herramientas para que los que componen nuestra compañía profundicen en sus habilidades, exploren nuevas áreas y se sientan una pieza fundamental.




Si estás buscando un lugar donde impulsar y desarrollar tu carrera profesional, únete a nosotros y sé parte de este equipo innovador 🤓

Title: Data Scientist & Machine Learning Engineer - (BDA)
Description:
Eurecat es el principal centro tecnológico de Cataluña y la segunda organización de investigación privada más grande del sur de Europa. Aglutina la experiencia de más de 800 profesionales y presta servicio a cerca de 2.000 empresas. I+D aplicado, servicios tecnológicos, formación de alta especialización, consultoría tecnológica o valorización y explotación de la propiedad industrial son algunos de los servicios que Eurecat ofrece tanto para grandes como para pequeñas y medianas empresas de todos los sectores. El centro tecnológico participa en más de 200 grandes proyectos consorciados de I+D+i nacionales e internacionales de alto valor estratégico y cuenta con 181 patentes y 10 spin-off. El valor añadido que aporta Eurecat acelera la innovación, disminuye el gasto en infraestructuras científicas y tecnológicas, reduce los riesgos y proporciona conocimiento especializado a medida de cada empresa.

Queremos incorporar a nuestro equipo de Data Science & Big Data Analytics

INVESTIGADOR/A - Data Scientist & Machine Learning

Estamos buscando un Data Scientist & Machine Learning Engineer con motivación y experiencia en el ámbito del Machine Learning aplicado, para unirse a nuestro equipo. Participarás en proyectos de desarrollo e innovación con un alto impacto tecnológico, utilizando algoritmos que pueden incluir predicción de series temporales, procesos estocásticos, machine learning clásico, natural language processing, deep learning y sistemas de recomendación, entre otros. Trabajarás con organizaciones de diversos sectores como cultural, legal, digital media, impacto social y digitalización. Además tendrás la posibilidad de desarrollar ideas de investigación aplicada y participar en la redacción de artículos científicos que serán presentados en conferencias internacionales.

Buscamos un perfil centrado en métodos de forecasting, análisis de series temporales y procesos estocásticos. También se valorará, como extra, conocimiento en los ámbitos del procesado de lenguaje natural (NLP), IA generativa, sistemas recomendadores y aprendizaje por refuerzo (reinforcement learning).

FUNCIONES Y RESPONSABILIDADES


Diseñar y desarrollar soluciones que respondan a los retos de los clientes o socios de los proyectos, según la experiencia del candidato y las necesidades de cada proyecto.
Escribir código limpio, eficiente y bien documentado para implementar las soluciones técnicas planteadas.
Investigar técnicas y métodos innovadores en el ámbito de la inteligencia artificial que conformen el estado del arte, a fin de mantenerse actualizado con las nuevas tendencias.
Participar en la preparación de propuestas de proyectos de investigación y desarrollo (p.ej. convocatorias CDTI Cervera, MICIU PCPPs, etc.), desde la toma de requerimientos con el cliente hasta el planteamiento de la solución técnica y la redacción del plan de trabajo.
Redactar documentación técnica básica, relacionada con las soluciones implementadas en los proyectos.
Participar en la redacción de artículos y presentaciones para compartir los resultados de la investigación y el desarrollo con la comunidad académica y la industria.



OFRECEMOS


Formación en ámbitos relacionados con el machine learning y la inteligencia artificial
Formación de idiomas (catalán, castellano, inglés)
Horario flexible y esquema híbrido de teletrabajo
Jornada laboral intensiva los viernes y horario de verano
Añádete a un equipo dinámico y multidisciplinar



Esta posición está ubicada en la sede de Barcelona de Eurecat

Requisitos:


Experiencia de, al menos, 3 años en el ámbito del machine learning aplicado, con un foco especial en el forecasting, en el análisis de series temporales y en procesos estocásticos.
Conocimiento y experiencia en análisis de datos, limpieza, preparación, pre-procesamiento y visualización.
Experiencia en el lenguaje de programación Python y en sus librerías más importantes en los ámbitos del machine learning (scikit-learn), deep learning (PyTorch o tensorflow), series temporales (statsmodels, StatsForecast, etc).
Altas capacidades de conceptualizar, diseñar y plantear soluciones.
Buenas capacidades de exposición y documentación de las tareas realizadas.
Experiencia en el uso de sistemas de control de versiones, en particular, Git.
Idiomas: alto nivel en catalán y/o castellano (en caso de no tener un nivel mínimo de catalán, el candidato tendrá que hacer la formación ofrecida por Eurecat o por su cuenta a partir del momento de la incorporación); buen nivel de inglés.



Se valorará:


Conocimiento en técnicas de NLP: generación de word-embeddings, búsquedas semánticas, named-entity recognition, Large Language Models, Retrieval-Augmented Generation, etc.
Conocimiento en sistemas recomendadores: content-based, collaborative filtering, Factorization Machines, etc.
Conocimiento en reinforcement learning: Q-Learning, simulaciones de Monte Carlo, etc.
Experiencia en proyectos en el sector de la movilidad.
PhD en un ámbito relacionado con la Ciencia de Datos y el Aprendizaje Automático.
Interés y experiencia en la investigación.
Haber participado en la publicación de artículos científicos y asistido a conferencias internacionales.
Haber participado en proyectos financiados por la Comisión Europea (Horizon Europe, H2020 y anteriores).
Experiencia en el uso de Docker y de sistemas Linux.

También se valorará, como extra, conocimiento en los ámbitos del procesado de lenguaje natural (NLP), IA generativa, sistemas recomendadores y aprendizaje por refuerzo (reinforcement learning).

FUNCIONES Y RESPONSABILIDADES

  • Diseñar y desarrollar soluciones que respondan a los retos de los clientes o socios de los proyectos, según la experiencia del candidato y las necesidades de cada proyecto.
  • Escribir código limpio, eficiente y bien documentado para implementar las soluciones técnicas planteadas.
  • Investigar técnicas y métodos innovadores en el ámbito de la inteligencia artificial que conformen el estado del arte, a fin de mantenerse actualizado con las nuevas tendencias.
  • Participar en la preparación de propuestas de proyectos de investigación y desarrollo (p.ej. convocatorias CDTI Cervera, MICIU PCPPs, etc.), desde la toma de requerimientos con el cliente hasta el planteamiento de la solución técnica y la redacción del plan de trabajo.
  • Redactar documentación técnica básica, relacionada con las soluciones implementadas en los proyectos.
  • Participar en la redacción de artículos y presentaciones para compartir los resultados de la investigación y el desarrollo con la comunidad académica y la industria.


OFRECEMOS

  • Formación en ámbitos relacionados con el machine learning y la inteligencia artificial
  • Formación de idiomas (catalán, castellano, inglés)
  • Horario flexible y esquema híbrido de teletrabajo
  • Jornada laboral intensiva los viernes y horario de verano
  • Añádete a un equipo dinámico y multidisciplinar


Esta posición está ubicada en la sede de Barcelona de Eurecat

Requisitos:

  • Experiencia de, al menos, 3 años en el ámbito del machine learning aplicado, con un foco especial en el forecasting, en el análisis de series temporales y en procesos estocásticos.
  • Conocimiento y experiencia en análisis de datos, limpieza, preparación, pre-procesamiento y visualización.
  • Experiencia en el lenguaje de programación Python y en sus librerías más importantes en los ámbitos del machine learning (scikit-learn), deep learning (PyTorch o tensorflow), series temporales (statsmodels, StatsForecast, etc).
  • Altas capacidades de conceptualizar, diseñar y plantear soluciones.
  • Buenas capacidades de exposición y documentación de las tareas realizadas.
  • Experiencia en el uso de sistemas de control de versiones, en particular, Git.
  • Idiomas: alto nivel en catalán y/o castellano (en caso de no tener un nivel mínimo de catalán, el candidato tendrá que hacer la formación ofrecida por Eurecat o por su cuenta a partir del momento de la incorporación); buen nivel de inglés.


Se valorará:

  • Conocimiento en técnicas de NLP: generación de word-embeddings, búsquedas semánticas, named-entity recognition, Large Language Models, Retrieval-Augmented Generation, etc.
  • Conocimiento en sistemas recomendadores: content-based, collaborative filtering, Factorization Machines, etc.
  • Conocimiento en reinforcement learning: Q-Learning, simulaciones de Monte Carlo, etc.
  • Experiencia en proyectos en el sector de la movilidad.
  • PhD en un ámbito relacionado con la Ciencia de Datos y el Aprendizaje Automático.
  • Interés y experiencia en la investigación.
  • Haber participado en la publicación de artículos científicos y asistido a conferencias internacionales.
  • Haber participado en proyectos financiados por la Comisión Europea (Horizon Europe, H2020 y anteriores).
  • Experiencia en el uso de Docker y de sistemas Linux.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer / Data Scientist
Description:
🌐 Híbrido en Barcelona

⌛ Tiempo completo

👨‍💻 Nivel Senior

Sobre INNOIT

En INNOIT, nos especializamos en la gestión de carreras profesionales en el ámbito de la tecnología de la información. Somos una consultora tecnológica y digital con sede en España, contamos con un equipo de más de 200 profesionales del sector y llevamos más de seis años participando en la transformación digital de destacadas empresas a nivel nacional e internacional.

Descripción Del Trabajo

✅ Responsabilidades:


Diseñar y desarrollar soluciones innovadoras de IA/ML en colaboración con el Centro de Excelencia OneAI
Desarrollar arquitectura de sistemas, hojas de ruta técnicas y prototipos
Construir, probar e implementar modelos de IA en producción aprovechando los servicios de AWS
Explorar continuamente nuevas técnicas y metodologías de IA para impulsar la innovación


👍 Tu Perfil


+4 años de experiencia en la arquitectura y el desarrollo de sistemas de IA/ML, +1 año de experiencia con sistemas GenAI
Experiencia en Python (4 años), SQL, PyTorch, TensorFlow y otras bibliotecas/marcos de ML
Experiencia en AI Generativa
Experiencia en la implementación de soluciones en plataformas en la nube como AWS. Familiaridad con los principios de MLOps y AIOps.
Es deseable contar con experiencia en Databricks
Experiencia en el desarrollo de proyectos empleando modelos de Deep Learning (Librerías Tensorflow o PyTorch). Se valora experiencia entrenando o haciendo fine tuning de LLM en casos reales.
Experiencia en prototipar soluciones basadas en Machine Learning
Marco metodológico Agile/Scrum
Castellano e inglés alto


🚀 Lo Que Te Ofrecemos

⏱ Horarios flexibles

💰 Salario competitivo + retribución flexible

🩺 Seguro médico

🎓 Formaciones técnicas y no técnicas

📚 Cursos de idiomas

🤓 Comunidades tecnológicas

🔄 Seguimiento continuo

🚀 Trayectoria profesional

Únete al equipo InnoIT, desarrolla tu talento en IT, aprende, crea y diviértete!

Te estamos esperando 😊así que si quieres saberlo todo, ¡contáctanos ya!

Si quieres conocernos más, puedes visitar nuestra web y nuestra app de Meetup:

👉https://www.inno-it.es/

👉Meetup De InnoIT Consulting En Barcelona

https://www.meetup.com/es-ES/Meetup-de-InnoIT-Consulting-en-Barcelona/?_locale=es-ES

👉Meetup De InnoIT Consulting En Madrid

https://www.meetup.com/es-ES/meetup-de-innoit-consulting-en-madrid/



Te lo hemos contado, aunque mejor vivirlo en primera persona

En InnoIT, promovemos activamente la diversidad, la equidad y la inclusión. Invitamos a personas de todos los orígenes y experiencias a aplicar, y valoramos especialmente las candidaturas de mujeres y otros grupos subrepresentados en el sector tecnológico. Evaluamos todas las solicitudes de manera equitativa y estamos comprometidos a realizar los ajustes necesarios para garantizar un proceso de selección justo y un entorno de trabajo inclusivo. No discriminamos por género, edad, origen étnico, nacionalidad, orientación sexual, identidad de género, religión, discapacidad o cualquier otra característica protegida por la ley.

Title: Artificial Intelligence internship
Description:
Objective

As an AI Intern at Fluendo, your main goal is to learn how our AI technology works and get familiar with the tools and workflows we use. You’ll be supporting senior AI engineers and helping other teams while gaining practical experience in real projects. This internship is a great opportunity to build a strong understanding of AI—both the theory behind it and how it's applied in real-world situations. Over time, you’ll develop the skills needed to take on more responsibilities and become an important part of the team.

Responsibilities


Help prepare datasets by organizing files, adding labels, and doing simple data cleaning
Assist with testing AI models and checking how well they work
Support the team by keeping tools and scripts updated
Help write down notes and keep track of AI features and experiments
Learn how our AI is used in real products by working with senior engineers
Follow our team’s way of working and learn how we build and improve AI at Fluendo



Requirements:

Skills & Competencies


Eager to learn and apply new knowledges
Open to support team members
Responsability with the working schedule and material
Proactivity in preparing presentations, demos, and documentation



Qualifications


Studies aligned with AI/Computer Vision (or any personal project)
Basic knowledge on Python development (appreciated also C++)
Fluent in English and Spanish.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job description: ZF Aftermarket is seeking a Data Scientist for its Customer Strategy & Commercial Excellence department, located in Barcelona’s 22@ innovation district. The company is expanding its advanced analytics capabilities, focusing on data-driven solutions in the rapidly evolving mobility sector. 

We invite you to watch the following keynote speech from our Vice President outlining ZF’s exciting new strategy in this space: Keynote Speech

What you can look forward to as Data Scientist:

Prototype Development: Create advanced analytics models for marketing, sales, pricing, and logistics.
Modeling Cycle: Understand business problems, explore data, create and test models, and iterate until the solution is business-ready.
Collaboration: Work closely with business analysts and stakeholders to improve models and provide actionable insights.

 

 

Profile description:

Your profile as Data Scientist:

Strong background in computing and statistics.
Experience with Python, R, Pyspark, and models such as neural networks and Bayesian modeling.
Familiarity with databases (e.g., Oracle, AWS) and big data platforms (e.g., Databricks, GCP).
Knowledge of visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
Soft skills like teamwork, business acumen, and data storytelling are essential.

 

 

We offer:

Why you should choose ZF in Barcelona?

Work-Life Balance: Flexible hours and a modern office environment in Barcelona.
Career Growth: Continuous learning and mentoring programs.
Collaborative Culture: Emphasis on teamwork and knowledge sharing.

 

The role is hybrid, requiring 3-4 days of presence at the Wojo office per week.

Title: Data Scientist Product Analyst (They/She/He)
Description:
If you’re here, it’s because you’re looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We’ll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

🤝 Our culture and strong values.

💪 Our career development philosophy.

🤝 Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: Building the largest marketplace in your city, to give access to anything in minutes. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Support the development of logistics features, quantifying the impact that they might bring to the company, supporting the design process with data to make decisions, coordinating the rollout of features, and measuring their impact.

THE JOURNEY


Work closely with product and operations teams to define the product roadmap and strategy, monitor and give visibility of product metrics and KPIs.
Apply data analytics and statistical techniques (e.g. A/B testing, multivariate testing, clustering) to uncover insights,validate product hypotheses and solve business problems that drive the highest impact.
Translate product questions and hypotheses into structured analyses that drive clear, actionable outcomes
Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
Owning everything analytics end to end in the product development cycle, from ideation and opportunity sizing, to experimentation and post-launch impact analyses.
Define feature optimization strategies by analyzing usage patterns and tailoring recommendations for each geography.
Build robust relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology,business and product.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


1-3 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role, preferably in product facing teams
Knowledge or experience in digital product development
Experience with an application of statistical modeling and advanced analytics to provide product-shaping insights
Excellent SQL skills and experience applying those on-the-job; you know how to join multiple tables, you know how and when to use CTEs, and you use aggregate functions to come up with relevant statistics
Solid proficiency in programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
Knowledgeable and preferably experienced in designing and analyzing experiments in digital products (A/B test, multivariate, etc)
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, Qlikview.
Excellent spoken and written English.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


🌟 An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
💪 Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
🍔 Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
💳 Discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
🏊 Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
🏖️ Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
👪 Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
🧠 Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About Us

We are a European startup dedicated to developing cutting-edge, automated wind-assisted propulsion systems. We aim to provide a turnkey solution for shipowners and shipping companies seeking to reduce fuel costs and emissions. Our vision is simple yet ambitious—we aim to power the world with wind.

Imagine a world where the vast oceans are effortlessly traversed using the clean and boundless power of the wind. At bound4blue, we are turning this dream into reality. We're not just creating wind propulsion systems but revolutionizing the maritime industry, one sustainable voyage at a time. While bringing sails back to ships may seem challenging, we are more than prepared for it. We are innovators who understand the perfect harmony between nature and technology.

About The Role

The Data Scientist will be responsible for designing and implementing mathematical models, developing robust analytical solutions, and integrating AI algorithms into deployment pipelines. The role requires close collaboration with multiple teams, including Product Development, Automation & Control, Aerodynamics, and Vessel Performance, to ensure analytical tools and models are aligned with product requirements and system architecture.

This position sits at the intersection of mathematics and engineering, translating complex concepts into actionable insights and scalable models that directly support decision-making and product evolution.

Key Responsibilities


Design, validate, and implement mathematical and physical models to solve real-world engineering challenges.
Apply vectorization and numerical computing techniques to efficiently process large datasets.
Develop and deploy machine learning and artificial intelligence models into production environments.
Collaborate closely with Engineering, Product, Analytics & Control, and Vessel Performance teams to ensure models are appropriately integrated into our systems.
Monitor and evaluate the performance of deployed models, identifying opportunities for refinement.
Participate in the design of experiments, sensitivity analysis, and numerical simulations to support R&D initiatives.


Required Competencies


PhD (preferred) or master’s degree in mathematics, Physics, Engineering, or a related quantitative field.
Strong foundation in mathematical modeling, linear algebra, differential calculus, statistics, and numerical methods.
Proficiency in scientific programming with Python and libraries such as NumPy, SciPy, Numba, Pandas, scikit-learn, PyTorch, or TensorFlow.
Familiarity with deployment pipelines and containerization tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
Experience handling large datasets both locally and in cloud environments.
Solid understanding of computational optimization and performance via vectorization and matrix operations.
Technical English proficiency (ability to read and write scientific literature and documentation).
Experience with physical simulations, system dynamics, or solving differential equations is a strong plus.
Knowledge of mathematical optimization (linear, nonlinear, combinatorial) and experience with model versioning and monitoring tools is desirable.
Mindset oriented toward applied problem-solving and industrial innovation, ideally with experience beyond the traditional software domain.


What Awaits You


Impactful Role: Contribute directly to the design and development of advanced wind-assisted propulsion systems, playing a central role in the implementation of models that influence product decisions.
Innovation at its Core: Join a team focused on building transformative technology that merges cutting-edge science with real-world engineering applications.
Collaborative Environment: Engage daily with multidisciplinary teams across engineering and product, working together toward a shared mission of sustainable maritime transport.
Growth and Development: Take part in a fast-evolving company where your ideas and contributions help shape the future of our technology and capabilities.


Join us and make a difference in the world of sustainable maritime technology!

bound4blue develops automated wind-assisted propulsion systems as a turnkey solution for all shipowners and shipping companies seeking to reduce fuel costs and polluting emissions. bound4blue’s eSAIL® system is a validated solution for saving fuel and emissions, completely autonomous, with low maintenance and easy installation onboard, being the most cost-efficient wind propulsion technology today.
Show more

The Data Scientist will be responsible for designing and implementing mathematical models, developing robust analytical solutions, and integrating AI algorithms into deployment pipelines. The role requires close collaboration with multiple teams, including Product Development, Automation & Control, Aerodynamics, and Vessel Performance, to ensure analytical tools and models are aligned with product requirements and system architecture.

This position sits at the intersection of mathematics and engineering, translating complex concepts into actionable insights and scalable models that directly support decision-making and product evolution.

Key Responsibilities

  • Design, validate, and implement mathematical and physical models to solve real-world engineering challenges.
  • Apply vectorization and numerical computing techniques to efficiently process large datasets.
  • Develop and deploy machine learning and artificial intelligence models into production environments.
  • Collaborate closely with Engineering, Product, Analytics & Control, and Vessel Performance teams to ensure models are appropriately integrated into our systems.
  • Monitor and evaluate the performance of deployed models, identifying opportunities for refinement.
  • Participate in the design of experiments, sensitivity analysis, and numerical simulations to support R&D initiatives.

Required Competencies

  • PhD (preferred) or master’s degree in mathematics, Physics, Engineering, or a related quantitative field.
  • Strong foundation in mathematical modeling, linear algebra, differential calculus, statistics, and numerical methods.
  • Proficiency in scientific programming with Python and libraries such as NumPy, SciPy, Numba, Pandas, scikit-learn, PyTorch, or TensorFlow.
  • Familiarity with deployment pipelines and containerization tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
  • Experience handling large datasets both locally and in cloud environments.
  • Solid understanding of computational optimization and performance via vectorization and matrix operations.
  • Technical English proficiency (ability to read and write scientific literature and documentation).
  • Experience with physical simulations, system dynamics, or solving differential equations is a strong plus.
  • Knowledge of mathematical optimization (linear, nonlinear, combinatorial) and experience with model versioning and monitoring tools is desirable.
  • Mindset oriented toward applied problem-solving and industrial innovation, ideally with experience beyond the traditional software domain.

What Awaits You

  • Impactful Role: Contribute directly to the design and development of advanced wind-assisted propulsion systems, playing a central role in the implementation of models that influence product decisions.
  • Innovation at its Core: Join a team focused on building transformative technology that merges cutting-edge science with real-world engineering applications.
  • Collaborative Environment: Engage daily with multidisciplinary teams across engineering and product, working together toward a shared mission of sustainable maritime transport.
  • Growth and Development: Take part in a fast-evolving company where your ideas and contributions help shape the future of our technology and capabilities.

Join us and make a difference in the world of sustainable maritime technology!

bound4blue develops automated wind-assisted propulsion systems as a turnkey solution for all shipowners and shipping companies seeking to reduce fuel costs and polluting emissions. bound4blue’s eSAIL® system is a validated solution for saving fuel and emissions, completely autonomous, with low maintenance and easy installation onboard, being the most cost-efficient wind propulsion technology today.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer, Intern
Description:
About Marvell

Marvell’s semiconductor solutions are the essential building blocks of the data infrastructure that connects our world. Across enterprise, cloud and AI, automotive, and carrier architectures, our innovative technology is enabling new possibilities.

At Marvell, you can affect the arc of individual lives, lift the trajectory of entire industries, and fuel the transformative potential of tomorrow. For those looking to make their mark on purposeful and enduring innovation, above and beyond fleeting trends, Marvell is a place to thrive, learn, and lead.

Your Team, Your Impact

The Central Engineering CAD organization at Marvell is a critical cog in the wheel of innovation. Without this team, Marvell would be unable to execute its vision of delivering cutting-edge technology to the world. Our team is responsible for developing design flows that are used by hundreds of engineers. These flows are instrumental in working with top-notch technologies like 3nm and 2nm, which are at the forefront of the semiconductor industry.

Every day, we work on supporting all business units within Marvell, providing them with the tools and processes they need to create their products. This gives our team members the unique opportunity to work on a variety of projects and teams, broadening their experience and knowledge. Our work directly impacts the success of the company and, by extension, the advancement of technology in the world.

We are looking for fresh graduates ready to jump start their career in the semiconductor industry and join our team in Barcelona.

What You Can Expect


Design, develop, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable Python code for command line tools.
Apply your knowledge of algorithms and machine learning to solve complex problems and implement solutions.
Analyze and process data for feature selection. Report findings and suggest improvements.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features. Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency.


What We're Looking For


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field, or equivalent experience.
Strong understanding of algorithms and machine learning.
Experience with Python and developing command line tools.
Familiarity with ASIC design is a plus, willing to learn ASIC design domain is a must.
Experience with classic Machine Learning algorithms and LLMs, GNNs.
Excellent problem-solving skills.
Strong communication and teamwork skills.
Great English both verbal and written.


Additional Compensation And Benefit Elements

With competitive compensation and great benefits, you will enjoy our workstyle within an environment of shared collaboration, transparency, and inclusivity. We’re dedicated to giving our people the tools and resources they need to succeed in doing work that matters, and to grow and develop with us. For additional information on what it’s like to work at Marvell, visit our Careers page.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.

Location: Sant Cugat, near Barcelona – Hybrid work – 2 days in a week at office.

A bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, Data Science, or a related field

Title: AI/ML Engineer
Description:
Overview

Keysight is on the forefront of technology innovation, delivering breakthroughs and trusted insights in electronic design, simulation, prototyping, test, manufacturing, and optimization. Our ~15,000 employees create world-class solutions in communications, 5G, automotive, energy, quantum, aerospace, defense, and semiconductor markets for customers in over 100 countries. Learn more about what we do.

Our award-winning culture embraces a bold vision of where technology can take us and a passion for tackling challenging problems with industry-first solutions. We believe that when people feel a sense of belonging, they can be more creative, innovative, and thrive at all points in their careers.

Responsibilities

At Eggplant, we empower organizations to create exceptional digital experiences. Businesses across the globe rely on Eggplant to outpace competitors, enhance productivity, and delight their customers. How? By transforming the quality, responsiveness, and performance of software applications across various interfaces, platforms, browsers, and devices—including mobile, IoT, and desktop—in agile, DevOps, and innovative application and data environments.

We believe in fostering an inclusive, collaborative, and innovative culture where everyone can thrive and contribute their unique perspectives to achieve shared goals.

About The Role

We are looking for a talented and experienced AI/ML Engineer with expertise in Generative AI and Natural Language Processing (NLP) to join our Eggplant GenAI Agile team. In this role, you will design, develop, and implement cutting-edge AI solutions that enhance our Eggplant test automation tool, helping businesses revolutionize their software testing processes.

You’ll work closely with a multidisciplinary team—including Product Managers, Frontend and Backend Engineers, and QA professionals—to integrate AI features that align with our ambitious product roadmap.

Key Responsibilities


Design, fine-tune, and deploy large language models (LLMs) and Generative AI systems to address real-world business needs, such as automating text generation, Gherkin scenarios, and test cases.
Assess and compare NLP techniques and Generative AI platforms through rigorous qualitative and quantitative analysis.
Continuously monitor model performance, implementing retraining and improvements to ensure accuracy, robustness, and scalability.
Stay at the forefront of AI advancements, applying research insights to develop innovative solutions.
Develop comprehensive AI/ML solution design documents in alignment with requirements detailed in Jira tickets.
Maintain clear, accessible documentation of models, experiments, and processes to promote knowledge sharing and collaboration.
Provide mentorship to peers and junior team members, fostering their growth in AI/ML expertise.


Qualifications

About You:

We’re looking for a proactive and self-motivated professional with a proven ability to deliver complex software features. You are passionate about AI/ML technologies, eager to learn, and thrive in collaborative environments.

You value diverse perspectives and bring enthusiasm for innovation and teamwork, along with excellent communication skills.

What You’ll Bring


Education: Master’s, or PhD in Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field.
Experience: Several years of proven industrial experience in AI/ML engineering or data science, with a strong focus on Generative AI models.
Technical Skills:
Hands-on expertise with LLMs and Generative AI methodologies, such as RAG, Vector DBs, Embeddings, Fine-Tuning, and Prompt Tuning.
Proficiency in Python, deep learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch), and NLP libraries (e.g., Hugging Face, spaCy).
Familiarity with DevSecOps tools like GitLab and cloud platforms such as AWS or Azure.
Experience with test automation tools is a plus.

Who You Are


A passionate advocate for cutting-edge technologies and their transformative potential.
An innovative thinker with a knack for identifying and leveraging new technologies to drive results.
Sociable, collaborative, and enthusiastic about working with a diverse team.
Pragmatic and solutions-oriented, with a focus on delivering value.
A strong communicator with excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills.


What We Offer


A culture that values diversity, inclusion, and collaboration.
Opportunities to work with cutting-edge AI technologies and shape the future of software testing.
A supportive environment for learning, growth, and career development.
Competitive compensation and benefits.


Careers Privacy Statement

***Keysight is an Equal Opportunity Employer.***

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
En FACTIC estamos ampliando nuestro equipo de Data y buscamos a un experto en datos para el análisis y la creación de soluciones Machine Learning e Inteligencia Artificial focalizados en el análisis predictivo, con entornos de desarrollo Python.




Participaran en el departamento de I+D desarrollando mejoras en los algoritmos de Inteligencia artificial propios y creando módulos de alta inovación para los nuevos proyectos internacionales.




Responsabilidades

Análisis de datos: evaluación de la calidad, limpieza, estructuración para el procesamiento posterior
Diseño de algoritmos de predicción precisos y escalables
Colaborar con el equipo de IA para llevar prototipos analíticos a producción.
Generar información procesable para mejoras comerciales




Conocimientos

Comprensión profunda del modelado predictivo, el aprendizaje automático, las técnicas de agrupación y clasificación y los algoritmos.
Al menos 1 o 2 años de experiencia en análisis cuantitativo o modelado de datos.
Comprensión profunda del modelado predictivo y machine learning, así como técnicas de agrupación y clasificación.
Se valorará formación relacionada con Matemáticas, Física, Informática o similar.
Imprescindible conocimiento en programación Python y bases de datos SQL. Se valorará experiencia en otros lenguajes como PHP.

Title: Data Scientist Optimization
Description:
Hello! We are Volotea, the airline of small and mid-sized cities in Europe.

Join our Data Science Team  and turn advanced optimization algorithms into real-world impact across multiple departments. You’ll build and maintain optimization algorithms, machine learning models, forecasting tools and data driven experiments that directly enhance operations, strategy, and more.

This is an incredible opportunity to combine your analytical and technical skills with creativity, to solve complex problems, collaborate with diverse teams, and make a real impact on our growth.


🚀 Take off with us! Your journey starts here.

How will it be to work with us?

- Design, build & refine optimization models: Develop metaheuristic algorithms (simulated annealing, constraint programming, etc.) and explore mathematical‑programming approaches.

- From prototype to production: Write clean, tested Python, review peers’ code; deploy services through our CI/CD pipeline.

- Monitor & improve performance: Profile algorithms, tune parameters, track KPIs, and ship incremental improvements.

- Expand beyond optimization: Take on projects in forecasting, experimentation design, causal inference, or ML as business needs evolve.

- Collaborate & Communicate: Work closely with operations, scheduling, finance and IT teams to turn data and constraints into actionable solutions.

- Stay ahead of trends: Apply new industry methods and academic research to enhance workflows and processes.

Why join us?

✈️ Travel the world for less

Enjoy exclusive deals with 180+ airlines—fly with your family for up to 4-5 times less than standard fares, just covering airport taxes. Weekend getaways or global adventures? You decide!

🏙 A prime location in Barcelona – And no, we’re not located at the airport!

You may not have seen us at Barcelona Airport, but there’s a reason for that—you’ll understand when you get to know us! 😉 Our HQ is in a top area, surrounded by great restaurants, shops, and services.

🤝 We work hard, but we have fun too!

We love bringing people together with events like:🎭 Carnival parties 🎢 Trips to Port Aventura 🎿 Ski getaways 🏃 Running clubs 🏓 Paddle & ping-pong tournaments

We’re an active, social team—there’s always something happening!

⚡ Make an impact – Bring your ideas to life! 🚀

At Volotea, your ideas matter. We give you the space and support to create, innovate, and shape the company’s future.

📝 A benefits plan that works for you

Customize your benefits! Allocate part of your salary to dining, transport, or health insurance, tax-free—meaning more savings for the things you love!

🧘‍♀️ Your well-being comes first

Enjoy discounted gym memberships, free fresh fruit, and coffee to keep you energized.

🌍 A global teamwork

In a diverse, multicultural environment where teamwork and innovation drive success.

📈 Grow your career with us

Access training in soft skills, office tools, and languages to boost your career.

⚖ Work-Life balance – Flexibility to thrive

With flexible schedules, hybrid work, flexible vacations, and your birthday off, you can grow professionally without compromising your well-being.


🚀 Ready to join us?


What will make you succeed in this position:

Degree in a quantitative field (like Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, or Computer Science), and you’re eager to apply that knowledge in practical, business-driven ways.

1+ year of hands-on experience in optimization, data science, operations research, machine learning, or software development — and you’re looking for your next challenge.

You write clean, well-structured Python code, and you care about quality, testing, and writing code that lasts.

Comfortable working with SQL and relational databases to dig into the data and uncover insights.

You're a creative problem solver — you enjoy exploring new approaches, tuning models, and iterating to find what works best.

You can explain complex ideas clearly and work well with non-technical teams — because you know that collaboration is key to turning data into action.

Fluency on English and Spanish, and you’re confident navigating bilingual environments.

🛠️ Our tech stack

Python (anaconda, uv, pandas, polars, NumPy, SciPy, scikit‑learn, LightGBM, shap, mlflow, optuna, jupyter, matplotlib, seaborn, streamlit, Flask, SQLAlchemy, pytest, etc.) · GitHub (git, ruff, pre‑commit) · VS Code & PyCharm · Docker · PostgreSQL, Redshift & Delta Lake · PySpark · DataBricks · Azure & AWS · Power BI

VOLOTEA | Jobs and Careers

VOLOTEA | Vuelos baratos, ofertas y billetes de avión a ciudades de toda Europa.




Listen to our Top Management introduce our culture at Volotea.


Volotea is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity and inclusion and strives to recruit diverse candidates. Our goal is to continuously improve and sustain an inclusive culture by attracting, developing, and engaging the best talent in our industry.

Title: ML Eng./Data Science Python Developer
Place: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
At ScaleneWorks People Solutions, we're more than recruiters; we're career architects dedicated to connecting exceptional talent with top-tier opportunities. Backed by industry experts, we prioritize relationships, offer global opportunities, and champion your success every step of the way.

Ready to shape your future? Explore opportunities with us today.




We are looking for a ML Eng./Data Science Python Developer, for our well-known client.




Location: Sant Cugat, Barcelona

Type of Work: hybrid work, 2 days from office (Sant Cugat)

Employment Contract




In this role, you will:

Improve our internal Python library used for model deployments by adding new features, cleaning up code, optimizing performance, and expanding unit testing.
Develop our Optimization Library from a proof of concept to a fully standardized tool for deploying optimization.
Standardize and streamline the data pipelines used for our forecast models.

Responsibilities:

Develop a detailed plan for refactoring/optimizing the code in Python while ensuring its functionality and performance are maintained
Write well-structured, efficient, and maintainable Python code, following best practices and company coding standards
Thoroughly test the new Python code, identify and resolve any bugs or issues, and ensure the results are consistent with the original implementation
Create clear documentation for the migrated Python code including comments, user guides, and technical specifications
Standardize and streamline the data pipelines used for our forecast models in PAT while defining and recommending the team best practices.
Communicate progress and challenges effectively with the project team and stakeholders

Required Skills:

A bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, Data Science, or a related field
At least 8 years of experience in a related role
Knowledge of algorithms, data structures, and best practices in software development
Strong programming skills in Python and experience with production grade python code
Deep knowledge of Python libraries such as Scikit-learn, PySpark, NumPy, Pandas
Familiarity with Python’s unit testing framework (currently using pytest)
Experience collaborating and using Github
Excellent communication and teamwork skills, with a strong attention to detail
Prior experience working with Databricks

Preferred Skills:

Prior experience with operationalization of ML models
Prior experience with ML models and collaborating with DS teams.
Familiarity with R programming language. This role might require to migrate some R code to Python/PySpark.
Experience with production grade pipelines and ideally with Databricks Delta Live tables or any other declarative pipelines

Title: Real World Evidence Data Scientist
Description:
Location: Barcelona

About The Job

Ready to push the limits of what's possible? Join Sanofi in one of our corporate functions and you can play a vital part in the performance of our entire business while helping to make an impact on millions around the world. As Real-World Evidence Data Scientist within our Business Operations team, you'll employ cutting-edge analytical approaches to drive evidence-based pharmaceutical product development.

We are an innovative global healthcare company with one purpose: to chase the miracles of science to improve people's lives. We're also a company where you can flourish and grow your career, with countless opportunities to explore, make connections with people, and stretch the limits of what you thought was possible. Ready to get started?

Main Responsibilities


Implement advanced machine learning and AI approaches to elucidate disease trajectories, identify patient subtypes, and define underdiagnosed conditions and unmet health needs
Create frameworks for generating re-usable models and insights across big-data (EHRs, claims) and rich small data sets (clinical trials, imaging)
Generate insights by merging diverse data streams including health, surveillance, trend data, sensor, and imaging information
Apply a broad array of capabilities spanning machine learning, statistics, mathematics, modeling, and text-mining to extract insights and communicate findings across the company
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including Business Units, Digital, R&D, Biostatistics, and IT to deliver cutting-edge analysis addressing key business questions


About You


Education: PhD in quantitative field such as Statistics, Biostatistics, Applied Mathematics or related field with relevant experience; or Master's Degree with extensive related industry or academic experience
Technical skills: Expertise in machine learning, statistical methodologies, and computational approaches for advanced analytics
Experience: Background in applying data science techniques to healthcare or pharmaceutical data
Soft skills: Strong oral and written communication skills; ability to work and collaborate in a team environment
Languages: Excellent knowledge of English language (spoken and written)


Why choose us?


Bring the miracles of science to life alongside a supportive, future-focused team
Discover endless opportunities to grow your talent and drive your career, whether it's through a promotion or lateral move, at home or internationally
Enjoy a thoughtful, well-crafted rewards package that recognizes your contribution and amplifies your impact
Take good care of yourself and your family, with a wide range of health and wellbeing benefits including high-quality healthcare, prevention and wellness programs and at least 14 weeks' gender-neutral parental leave
Work with cutting-edge technologies and methodologies in a dynamic, global environment
Contribute to meaningful projects that directly impact patient outcomes and healthcare decisions


Pursue Progress. Discover Extraordinary.

Progress doesn’t happen without people – people from different backgrounds, in different locations, doing different roles, all united by one thing: a desire to make miracles happen. You can be one of those people. Chasing change, embracing new ideas and exploring all the opportunities we have to offer. Let’s pursue progress. And let’s discover extraordinary together.

At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity.

Watch our ALL IN video and check out our Diversity Equity and Inclusion actions at sanofi.com!

Title: Junior Developer for Data Science and AI Applications
Description:
Job Description:

Design and development of Data Science and AI applications within an international and innovative development team.
Development, optimization for AI- and Data Science-specific components within applications, such as virtual assistant systems based on multimodal RAG and agent systems.
Contribution to the implementation of a comprehensive digitalization roadmap to optimize business processes using AI.
Consulting and supporting departments in modeling and implementing Data Science and AI use cases – from requirement gathering to modeling, deployment, and versioning.
Training internal employees in Data Science and AI through various learning and enabling formats.

Requirements:

Experience as a Data Scientist, Machine Learning Engineer, or in a comparable role, with a completed degree (Bachelor/Master) in Computer Science, Mathematics, or equivalent knowledge and skills.
Experience in defining requirements and developing use cases throughout the complete lifecycle of Data Science and AI solutions – from data annotation, model selection, training, validation, deployment, to solution monitoring and refinement.
Hands-on experience with (multimodal) AI models (text, vision, speech) from open- and closed-source providers, along with proven expertise in relevant prompting and fine-tuning strategies is essential.
Hands-on experience with various RAG techniques is essential. Experience with single- and multi-agent systems is beneficial.
Proven hands-on expertise in implementing Data Science and AI use cases using Python and relevant Data Science and AI libraries.
Experience with AWS Cloud and respective services is desirable; experience with other cloud providers and services is an advantage.
Knowledge and familiarity with agile software development processes such as SCRUM is a benefit.
Communication and visualization skills to mediate between different stakeholder groups and to support colleagues.
Strong way of independent and team-oriented working is an essential requirement for the job positioning.
Very good command of English, both spoken and written, is a must.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Si estás buscando un cambio, quieres nuevos retos y eres especialista en Data... ¡Sigue leyendo porque esta oferta te interesará!




Estamos buscando un perfil de Data Scientist especializado en optimización para trabajar en una posición estable en uno de nuestros principales clientes.




Como Data Scientist, trabajarás en conjunto con equipos multidisciplinarios para identificar necesidades empresariales, convertirlas en modelos matemáticos y diseñar algoritmos de optimización eficaces.




Tus principales responsabilidades serán:




Análisis y procesamiento de datos:

Recopilar, limpiar y preparar datos provenientes de diversas fuentes para su uso en procesos de optimización y análisis.

Realizar algoritmos de optimización:

Diseñar e implementar algoritmos de optimización metaheurística como los Algoritmos Genéticos (GA).
Resolver problemas matemáticos complejos mediante el diseño y la implementación de soluciones de optimización personalizadas.
Analizar y ajustar los algoritmos de optimización para garantizar que cumplan con los objetivos de rendimiento establecidos.

Modelado de problemas:

Convertir reglas de negocio complejas en restricciones matemáticas aplicables a problemas de optimización.
Colaborar con las partes interesadas para comprender los requisitos y crear soluciones personalizadas para desafíos operativos específicos.

Colaboración y comunicación:

Trabajar en estrecha coordinación con los equipos de desarrollo de productos.
Presentar los resultados y las implicaciones de los modelos a líderes senior y partes interesadas clave.

Mentoría:

Brindar orientación y apoyo a científicos de datos junior, ayudándolos a aplicar técnicas de optimización y mejores prácticas.
Compartir conocimientos y experiencias dentro del equipo para promover una cultura de aprendizaje continuo y mejora constante.







Requisitos a nivel técnico:

Experiencia con herramientas y bibliotecas de visualización de datos.
Conocimientos de manipulación de datos, procesos ETL (Extracción, Transformación, Carga) y limpieza de datos.
Familiaridad con técnicas y herramientas de optimización lineal (por ejemplo, Gurobi, CPLEX).
Experiencia con infraestructura basada en la nube (preferiblemente AWS) para implementar modelos de optimización.
Exposición a herramientas y bibliotecas para el modelado matemático avanzado (por ejemplo, Pyomo, OR-Tools).
Dominio de Python o R y bibliotecas de ciencia de datos (por ejemplo, Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn), así como de bibliotecas centradas en la optimización como PuLP, Pyomo y marcos metaheurísticos como DEAP y Optuna.




Este puesto de trabajo está hecho para ti si dispones de:

Un Grado universitario en matemáticas aplicadas, ingeniería informática, o similares.
Dispones de un nivel alto de español e inglés hablado y escrito.
Un mínimo de 3 a 5 años de experiencia en data science o similar.
Capacidad comprobada para traducir problemas matemáticos complejos en algoritmos de optimización accionables.







Trabajar con nosotros te aportará:

Participar en proyectos desafiantes en un entorno dinámico.
Posición estable con plan de carrera dentro de la empresa.
Tendrás contratación indefinida desde el primer momento.
Formato híbrido de teletrabajo.
Dispondrás de retribución flexible y ticket restaurant entre otros beneficios.







Si te interesa la oportunidad y conocer todos los detalles, no dudes en aplicar al puesto para que podamos contactarte y hablar mejor sobre la posición, darte todos los detalles y resolver cualquier duda que te pueda surgir.




Agap2 es una empresa que ofrece igualdad de oportunidades, por ello nos comprometemos a tratar todas las candidaturas por igual en función de sus capacidades, logros y experiencia. Animamos a cualquier persona a presentar su candidatura que será tratada con igualdad de oportunidades independientemente de su raza, nacionalidad, sexo, edad, discapacidad, orientación sexual, identidad de género o cualquier otra característica.

Title: ML engineer / Data Science Python Developer
Description:
Below is the narrow down what customer is looking for:

looking for 3 things in order of priority:




Somebody that is good at code refactoring, standardization, and code optimization.
Strong in Python and able extend internal Python libraries.
Strong computer science background or experience.
Able to standardize Data Eng. Pipelines.
Experience in Data Eng best practices and tools.
Experience with SQL; Pyspark.
Experience to Deploy ML models in production.
Machine Learning / Data Science basic knowledge.
Experience Deploying models in production.




What customer not looking for:

Data Scientist that created models using Python libraries but with limited Python experience. – Customer have some team members with this profile.
Data Scientist with LLM/GenAI experience or Image processing/models. It is very different of what customer do and is an experience that won't help.

In this role, you will:

Improve our internal Python library used for model deployments by adding new features, cleaning up code, optimizing performance, and expanding unit testing.
Develop our Optimization Library from a proof of concept to a fully standardized tool for deploying optimization.
Standardize and streamline the data pipelines used for our forecast models.
