Title: Senior Software Engineer (Python)
Description:
Every day, the world gets more digital thanks to tens of millions of developers building the future faster than ever. But with exponential growth comes exponential risk, as outnumbered security teams struggle to secure mountains of code. This is where Snyk (pronounced “sneak”) comes in. Snyk is a developer security platform that makes it easy for development teams to find, prioritize, and fix security vulnerabilities in code, dependencies, containers, and cloud infrastructure — and do it all right from the start. Snyk is on a mission to make the world a more secure place by empowering developers to develop fast and stay secure.

Joining Snyk means embracing our core values: One Team, Care Deeply, Customer Centric, and Forward Thinking. As a member of our team, you’ll have the opportunity to thrive in a dynamic environment where fostering collaboration, leading with empathy, driving business impact, and inspiring trust are at the heart of everything we do.

Our Opportunity

Snyk, a leader in developer security, has recently acquired Probely, a modern Dynamic Application Security Testing (DAST) provider based in Portugal, with coverage of API security testing and web applications.

In this role, you will develop our backend and APIs, adding features and improving existing ones. Our backend connects all components and teams, requiring you to collaborate closely with all teams to understand the scope and requirements of the features under development.

You’ll Spend Your Time


Analyzing requirements, specifications, and technical design documents in preparation for development.
Develop backend components that support new or existing features.
Working with the different teams to discuss and implement technical solutions, and fix and identify bugs.
Implementing tests for any developed code.
Reviewing and testing teammate's code.


What You’ll Need


At least 5 years of professional experience as a Backend Engineer, Software Developer, or similar role.
Strong experience with Python
Strong commitment to code quality, and the value of giving and receiving feedback through code reviews.
Ability to deal with ambiguity, and respond with agility when requirements and priorities change.
An ability to lift the performance of a team through coaching and mentoring of more junior engineers.
Effective communicator both verbally and in writing.


We’d Be Lucky If You


An interest in and knowledge of security concepts is valued.
Enjoy talking with customers to identify, prioritize and solve problems iteratively and build something that they really love.
Feed off complex technical problems and find solutions where others see roadblocks.


We care deeply about the warm, inclusive environment we’ve created and we value diversity – we welcome applications from those typically underrepresented in tech. If you like the sound of this role but are not totally sure whether you’re the right person, do apply anyway!

About Snyk

Snyk is committed to creating an inclusive and engaging environment where our employees can thrive as we rally behind our common mission to make the digital world a safer place. From Snyk employee resource groups, to global benefits that help our employees prioritize their health, wellness, financial security, and a work/life blend, we aim to support our employees along their entire journeys here at Snyk.

Benefits & Programs

Prioritize health, wellness, financial security, and life balance with programs tailored to your location and role.


Flexible working hours, work-from home allowances, in-office perks, and time off for learning and self development
Generous vacation and wellness time off, country-specific holidays, and 100% paid parental leave for all caregivers
Health benefits, employee assistance plans, and annual wellness allowance
Country-specific life insurance, disability benefits, and retirement/pension programs, plus mobile phone and education allowances


Show more

Title: Backend Developer - Kotlin & Spring
Description:
You’ll be focused in


Collaborating within a cross-functional DevOps team to build digital products for eMobility, Fleet, and Driver management.
Designing and implement scalable, resilient, secure, and observable microservices.
Applying SOLID principles and Clean Code best practices (code so clean it practically debugs itself).
Ensuring code quality through automated testing and thorough code reviews.
Deploying efficiently and cost-effectively to AWS environments using CI/CD pipelines.
Collaborating closely with Product Owners to define technically feasible and effective solutions.
Working within an international team distributed across Lisbon, Munich, and Porto.



In order to succeed, you’ll need


Bachelor's degree in computer science, software engineering, or comparable work experience
Proven experience working as a Backend Developer or related role
Strong understanding of microservice and event-driven architecture principles.
Hands-on experience with Java/Kotlin, Spring (including Spring Boot), and JUnit.
Basic proficiency in Python.
Proficiency with relational databases (e.g., PostgreSQL) and NoSQL databases (e.g., MongoDB).
Experience working with AWS cloud services.
Proven ability to deliver complex IT solutions within Agile product development environments.
Advanced proficiency in English (spoken and written).



Nice to have


Experience developing AI-powered products.
Familiarity with front-end frameworks such as React.



Company Benefits


1200€ to equip your home office
720€ gross/year home allowance
Performance bonus
Health insurance extendable to your household
Wellbeing program extendable to your household
Life insurance
Pension fund
Smartphone & Unlimited phone data plan
Discounts on VW Group cars and special financing conditions
Relocation package & Visa process sponsorship (if applicable)



Cool Things You’ll Experience In Our Work Environment


Tailored remote-friendly setup for every team's vibe!
Flexible working hours
Multicultural reality with + 30 different nationalities
Pet friendly environment
Boost your career with our internal mobility program, focused on your personal & professional growth
Mix and mingle across teams for idea-sharing and bonding



About VWDS

Technology-driven trends such as diverse mobility, electrification and connectivity will revolutionize the mobility industry in the next decade. Volkswagen Group, as world leader in the automotive industry, is setting the pace for this revolution.

At Volkswagen Digital Solutions (VWDS) we are the go-to team to tackle complex systems and programming challenges. We make sure that our products flow smoothly in all stages of the digital value chain.

Our main areas of focus: vehicle software & operations, mobile online services, IT security, fleet management, sales & after sales, purchasing & logistics and product portfolio management.

Ready to #ExploreNewRoads? Join us! 🚗
Show more
HTML:
You’ll be focused in

  • Collaborating within a cross-functional DevOps team to build digital products for eMobility, Fleet, and Driver management.
  • Designing and implement scalable, resilient, secure, and observable microservices.
  • Applying SOLID principles and Clean Code best practices (code so clean it practically debugs itself).
  • Ensuring code quality through automated testing and thorough code reviews.
  • Deploying efficiently and cost-effectively to AWS environments using CI/CD pipelines.
  • Collaborating closely with Product Owners to define technically feasible and effective solutions.
  • Working within an international team distributed across Lisbon, Munich, and Porto.


In order to succeed, you’ll need

  • Bachelor's degree in computer science, software engineering, or comparable work experience
  • Proven experience working as a Backend Developer or related role
  • Strong understanding of microservice and event-driven architecture principles.
  • Hands-on experience with Java/Kotlin, Spring (including Spring Boot), and JUnit.
  • Basic proficiency in Python.
  • Proficiency with relational databases (e.g., PostgreSQL) and NoSQL databases (e.g., MongoDB).
  • Experience working with AWS cloud services.
  • Proven ability to deliver complex IT solutions within Agile product development environments.
  • Advanced proficiency in English (spoken and written).


Nice to have

  • Experience developing AI-powered products.
  • Familiarity with front-end frameworks such as React.


Company Benefits

  • 1200€ to equip your home office
  • 720€ gross/year home allowance
  • Performance bonus
  • Health insurance extendable to your household
  • Wellbeing program extendable to your household
  • Life insurance
  • Pension fund
  • Smartphone & Unlimited phone data plan
  • Discounts on VW Group cars and special financing conditions
  • Relocation package & Visa process sponsorship (if applicable)


Cool Things You’ll Experience In Our Work Environment

  • Tailored remote-friendly setup for every team's vibe!
  • Flexible working hours
  • Multicultural reality with + 30 different nationalities
  • Pet friendly environment
  • Boost your career with our internal mobility program, focused on your personal & professional growth
  • Mix and mingle across teams for idea-sharing and bonding


About VWDS

Technology-driven trends such as diverse mobility, electrification and connectivity will revolutionize the mobility industry in the next decade. Volkswagen Group, as world leader in the automotive industry, is setting the pace for this revolution.

At Volkswagen Digital Solutions (VWDS) we are the go-to team to tackle complex systems and programming challenges. We make sure that our products flow smoothly in all stages of the digital value chain.

Our main areas of focus: vehicle software & operations, mobile online services, IT security, fleet management, sales & after sales, purchasing & logistics and product portfolio management.

Ready to #ExploreNewRoads? Join us! 🚗

Title: Software Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
Linde Portugal, LDA

Software Engineer (m/f/d)

Lisbon, Portugal | req23172

What You Will Enjoy Doing


You will be responsible for working directly with customer data to develop the next generation of cloud-based applications, including both backend and frontend development
Furthermore, you will have the opportunity to build and experiment with tooling for CI/CD, enabling reliable and sustainable software delivery
Your role will involve performing reliability and performance testing, and establishing process management tools and application monitoring
In addition to that, you will be tasked with developing prototypes and building replication pipelines of existing solutions, while also connecting to other systems
Your work will involve close collaboration with Data Scientists and ML Engineers on the AI team
You will have the chance to collaborate with colleagues across different corporate functions and international teams


What Makes You Great


You have a Bachelors Degree in Computer Science / Engineering, or equivalent demonstratable prior experience
Strong experience developing both backend (e.g.. Python, Rust) and frontend applications (e.g.. react) is part of your profile
You are able to write idiomatic and maintainable code using where applicable the latest conventions of languages + frameworks
Furthermore you bring foundational experience working with SQL/NoSQL databases to the role
You demonstrate foundational experience with building and operating CI/CD pipelines
You possess relevant knowledge and basic practical experience with a major cloud platform (i.e.. Azure, AWS, GCP)
Also, you are strong in written and verbal communication in English


Why you will love working with us

Linde is a leading global industrial gases and engineering company with 2024 sales of $33 billion. We live our mission of making our world more productive every day by providing high-quality solutions, technologies and services which are making our customers more successful and helping to sustain, decarbonize and protect our planet.

The company serves a variety of end markets such as chemicals & energy, food & beverage, electronics, healthcare, manufacturing, metals and mining. Linde's industrial gases and technologies are used in countless applications including production of clean hydrogen and carbon capture systems critical to the energy transition, life-saving medical oxygen and high-purity & specialty gases for electronics. Linde also delivers state-of-the-art gas processing solutions to support customer expansion, efficiency improvements and emissions reductions.

Linde employees learn and abide the Linde Code of Ethics and Code of Conduct by demonstrating honesty, integrity, professionalism in all communications, actions, and decisions.

What we offer you!

At Linde, the sky is not the limit. If you’re looking to build a career where your work reaches beyond your job description and betters the people with whom you work, the communities we serve, and the world in which we all live, at Linde, your opportunities are limitless. Be Linde. Be Limitless.

This role is a full time position based on an unlimited contract. The standard weekly working hours will be from 08:00 hrs till 17:00 hrs.

Have we inspired you?

We are looking forward to receiving your application via our online job market.

Your contact person

Linde GmbH, Corporate Office

Chris Kalas

+49 152 03431257

Any designations used of course apply to persons of all genders. The form of speech used here is for simplicity only.

Linde Portugal, LDA acts responsibly towards its shareholders, business partners, employees, society and the environment in every one of its business areas, regions and locations across the globe. The company is committed to technologies and products that unite the goals of customer value and sustainable development.

Job Description

Estamos à procura de um Developer Energyworx para integrar as nossas equipas.

Conhecimentos de cloud GCP, Python, Java e SQL.
Capacidade de trabalho em equipa e em metodologia Agile.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success.
Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.




DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.




DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.







At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for a Data Scientist to join us.




Required Competencies:

MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field (MSc/PhD in Data Science is a plus)

Between 2 and 4 years of professional experience as a Data Scientist or a similar role

Proven knowledge and experience in Machine Learning, NLP, and text dataset curation

Hands-on experience in coding for real-world data analytics applications

Experience in NLP tasks, such as Text Classification, NER, and Information Retrieval

Experience working with LLMs, OpenAI API (or equivalent), and RAG

Proficiency in Python and ML/DL packages (PyTorch, NumPy, Scikit-Learn, Pandas)

Solid mathematical foundations and experience in statistical consultancy

Strong business sense with the ability to quickly understand use cases

Familiarity with data engineering, modeling, and business analysis

Good communication skills

Fluency in English and Portuguese

Preferential Competencies:

Experience with Cafe

Programming languages like Java, R and C++

Knowledge of cloud tools such as Azure, AWS, Google Cloud

Experience with MLOPs practices

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Workster is partnering with a global leader in the mobility space, transforming the industry with cutting-edge innovations and a fully digitalized approach. Join their Data Science team and help drive business processes like pricing with sophisticated algorithms. Make a direct impact on millions of customers and the company’s business results.




Your Role:




Develop and maintain a solid infrastructure within the Data Science team, focusing on DevOps processes and cloud technologies.
Establish and extend tools to automate the Data Science Tech Stack to continuously improve MLOps processes, including model deployment and data pipelines.
Ensure a reliable and scalable deployment foundation for Data Science machine learning models and algorithms, collaborating closely with other departments like cloud infrastructure.
Work with stakeholders across departments to achieve business goals and enhance the overall performance of the company’s systems.
Build and maintain infrastructure as code (IaC) using tools like Terraform to manage cloud resources.
Make data science experiments production-ready, ensuring they are monitored, robust, and scalable.




Your Qualifications:




Strong knowledge of cloud technologies, ideally in AWS, with 3 years experience in this domain.
Solid coding skills in Python and experience with continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) approaches.
Experience with Infrastructure as Code (IaC), ideally Terraform, is a strong plus.
Familiarity with containerization technologies such as Docker and container orchestration systems like Kubernetes.
Ideally, knowledge of the operational deployment of machine learning applications.
Ideally, experience in data engineering, including data modeling, database systems, and ETL processes.
Experience with monitoring and logging tools to detect and diagnose issues in machine learning models and supporting infrastructure.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, fluency in English, and an appreciation for cultural diversity.




The Offer:




Generous Time Off: Enjoy 28 days of vacation, an additional day off for your birthday, and 1 volunteer day per year.
Work-Life Balance & Flexibility: Benefit from a hybrid working model, flexible working hours, and no dress code.
Great Employee Benefits: Access discounts on services like rent, share, ride, and SIXT+, along with partner discounts.
Training & Development: Participate in training programs, external conferences, and internal dev & tech talks for personal growth.
Health & Well-being: Private health insurance to support your well-being.
Additional Perks: Enjoy the Coverflex advantage system to enhance your employee experience.

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Officer - Junior
Description:
Mission

Job Description

Develop End to End Product Lifecycle:


Develop Machine Learning (ML) and Artificial Intelligence (AI) solutions i.e., collect and label data, setup and train models, test and evaluate results
Develop, modify, and support in-house applications, working together with the data scientists and developers of the AC team
Work closely with clients during all stages of the application life cycle
Design the most adequate approaches to solve the identified problems within the company’s framework


Implement and assist the deployment and maintenance of models and software’s:


Follow industry best practices to implement and scale out the developed solutions into production grade software
Assist the operational teams with the deployment, monitoring and maintenance of the developed solutions
Contribute to disseminate a culture of data driven solutions within CIB
Maintain a strong market watch on the latest developments on methodologies, technologies and tools


Main Tasks


Develop End to End Product Lifecycle
Implement and assist the deployment and maintenance of models and software’s


Profile

Technical Skills


Ability to explain the results of a model and the different elements impacting it
Statistical and quantitative analysis skills (e.g., machine learning models, statistical models, Bayesian statistics, probability theory, time series analysis
Knowledge of at least one ML development stack (e.g. scikit-learn, keras, …)
Knowledge of NLP techniques


Language Skills


Fluent English
French and Portuguese are a plus
Effective Programming skills (e.g., Python, R, Java, Go) and algorithmic knowledge.
Knowledge of databases and associated tools (SQL and NoSQL)
Familiarity with continuous integration tools (pref. Jenkins, Git)
Knowledge of deep learning architectures and frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow,…)


Soft Skills


Ability to think abstractly and creatively
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Flexibility: ability to work in a changing environment


Education


Engineer School/master’s degree from university with a specialization in mathematics, statistics, computer science, data science or any engineering related field
Although not strictly required a PhD on data-science, engineering or related fields is an advantage


Organization

Inetum is a European leader in digital services. Inetum’s team of 28,000 consultants and specialists strive every day to make a digital impact for businesses, public sector entities and society. Inetum’s solutions aim at contributing to its clients’ performance and innovation as well as the common good. Present in 19 countries with a dense network of sites, Inetum partners with major software publishers to meet the challenges of digital transformation with proximity and flexibility. Driven by its ambition for growth and scale, Inetum generated sales of 2.5 billion euros in 2023.
Show more

Present in 19 countries with a dense network of sites, Inetum partners with major software publishers to meet the challenges of digital transformation with proximity and flexibility. Driven by its ambition for growth and scale, Inetum generated sales of 2.5 billion euros in 2023.

Somos uma consultora de tecnologias de informação com foco em projetos de Engenharia associados às Tecnologias da Informação. Atuamos em dois eixos principais: OTS e DxSpark, concentrando o que fazemos de melhor em cada um deles. Contamos com uma equipa diversa, de cerca de 200 profissionais, apaixonados e comprometidos em transformar desafios em oportunidades.

Entra em contato connosco e embarca nesta jornada rumo ao sucesso, aqui vais encontrar o teu próximo desafio #daretochange.

Dare To Have

  • Licenciatura em Engenharia Informática, Matemática ou similar é valorizado;
  • Conhecimentos comprovados em Data Warehousing e Data Marts;
  • Experiência na implementação de ETL;
  • Experiência com SQL superior a 2 anos;
  • Conhecimentos com linguagens de scripting (Python e R);
  • Fluência em Inglês, Francês ou Espanhol é valorizado.

Dare To Live

Global Mindset | integração numa empresa internacional de rápido crescimento;

Continuous Learning | plano de formação e certificação gratuitas em tecnologias, metodologias, línguas e soft-skills;

Infinite Feedback | acompanhamento e progressão de carreira;

Health | Seguro de saúde, dentário e seguro de vida;

Partnerships| benefícios e descontos em restaurantes, ginásios, viagens, farmácias e muito mais;

Celebrations| celebramos juntos perto ou longe e com prendas especiais;

Referral Program | programa de referência de colegas e amigos;

Stack| portátil, pacote de dados e kit de boas-vindas;

Diversity| Na Bee Engineering valorizamos a diversidade, defendemos a equidade e empenhamo-nos em criar um ambiente seguro, baseado no espírito de equipa e entreajuda. Estamos comprometidos em desenvolver práticas promotoras da igualdade de oportunidades e em combater a discriminação;

Sustainability & CSR | Enquanto empresa, temos um plano estratégico de ações definido, assente nos objetivos de desenvolvimento sustentável (Agenda 2030, ONU), com o objetivo de nos movermos de forma responsável e contribuirmos para um mundo mais sustentável e justo.

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
The Analytics Efficiency and Performance area of Networks Platform is looking to recruit a Data Scientist.


EDP is a global energy group present in around 30 markets with a particular emphasis on renewable energies. With more than 45 years of experience, we have been consolidating a relevant presence on the world energy scene based on the commitment to be all-green by 2030, leading the energy transition. With more than 13,000 employees around the world, we are committed to using our energy and heart to drive a better tomorrow.


What you will do:

  • Develop studies and models to support the detection of consumption anomalies and revenue losses, using different analytical methods of Business Intelligence and Machine Learning;
  • Provide technical and operational support to the analytical processes for detecting revenue-at-risk situations, promoting interaction with the involved areas;
  • Ensure the monitoring and tracking of the performance of these processes, identifying new business requirements and collaborating in their implementation;
  • Support the development and maintenance of regulatory reporting processes and other kpi.

Employment type: Full-Time

Work site: Hybrid Model

Work Place: Lisbon or Porto


What are we looking for:

  • Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Mathematics, Economics, or another relevant experience for the position.
  • Up to 3 years' experience in a similar role.
  • Additional training (e.g., postgraduate studies) in Data Science, Machine Learning, or other relevant areas is valued.
  • Experiência em Database (e.g., PL-SQL or T-SQL) (mandatory);
  • Valoriza-se experiência com as seguintes ferramentas:
  • Python or R;
  • Azure/Databricks, with a focus on developments supported by PySpark or similar;
  • Data visualization tools (e.g., PowerBi).
  • Knowledge in the field of electrical engineering - energy is valued;
  • Proficiency in Portuguese and English (mandatory), both spoken and written;
  • Proficiency in Office tools;
  • Strong analytical, organizational, and communication skills with the ability to influence and engage stakeholders.
  • Proactive, autonomous, and resilient, with experience in global, multi-project environments.

More than academic knowledge and technical skills, we are looking for ambitious people who are enthusiastic about the future and who bring human skills aligned with our purpose.


Equal opportunities for all

Our vision is that each person combines their unique characteristics and experiences to fulfill our mission of creating new energy for the planet. We are an inclusive employer, ensuring all candidates are treated fairly throughout the recruitment process. We welcome and value all people, and we are committed to fostering a sense of belonging for each person who is part of the EDP group.


Need more reasons to apply?

As a top employer we:

  • Empower our employees through a positive and innovative work environment that promotes collaboration and agile decision-making;
  • Respect and value each person, providing a flexible, healthy, and inclusive workplace with a range of attractive benefits;
  • Provide a meaningful work experience and prepare our people for future challenges through different opportunities for development and internal mobility;


Our efforts have resulted in several distinctions over time, highlighting the EDP group's strong positioning and its dedication and commitment to attracting and retaining the best talent:

  • Top employer certification by Top Employers Institute
  • Part of the Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index
  • Global certification as a family-responsible company by Fundación Másfamília
  • Top 100 Workplaces by Houston Chronicle


Discover our tips to enhance your performance during the recruitment process and apply until 22/05/2025 if you think you are the right fit for this opportunity.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We are in Business for People, empowering people in service organizations with innovative Enterprise and Business software solutions. We’ve innovated and taken a new approach to delivering ERP that works for people. Self-driving, adaptive and intuitive software that is changing the way people work. Our solutions empower people and deliver a better people experience so people can spend time on meaningful high value work they live for.



Read more on our website about how we transform work and how people feel about it, so our customers and their people can thrive.





Job Description



As a Data Scientist - Machine Learning Engineer at Unit4, you will help design, develop, and deploy machine learning models that drive innovation and efficiency in our software solutions. You will work closely with data engineers, software developers, and product managers to ensure our models are scalable, robust, ethically designed, and aligned with business goals.





Qualifications



Key Responsibilities:



Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including software engineers and product managers, to support the design and integration of responsible ML solutions into company products.
Design, develop, deploy, and maintain machine learning models to solve diverse business challenges.
Implement ML workflows using MLOps best practices for continuous integration and deployment.
Ensure reproducibility, performance, reliability, scalability, and security of ML models in production.
Implement responsible AI principles to ensure fairness, accountability, and transparency in AI solutions.
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and advancements in machine learning and MLOps.

Requirements:



Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics or a related field.
Master’s degree in Data Science, AI, or a related field is desirable.
Strong understanding and experience in machine learning and MLOps.
Strong proficiency in Python and experience with ML frameworks.
Experience with Azure, ML lifecycle management tools (Azure Machine Learning Studio, MLflow, Databricks, etc.), and containerization tools (Kubernetes, Docker).
Experience working with big data technologies is a plus.
Experience in data quality and compliance is a plus.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Ability to work in an agile and fast-paced development environment.


Additional Information



Join Unit4 and be part of one of the most exciting journeys in the cloud ERP software space. We’re a fast-paced, high-growth, people-centric company, delivering enterprise software for a great people experience, and offering our own people a host of benefits and development opportunities. Grow with us At Unit4, we offer:

• a culture built on trust - giving you the freedom and autonomy to be successful;

• balance - with our uncapped time off policy, remote working opportunities and Global Wellbeing Days when the whole company can switch off and prioritize well-being;

• talented colleagues, role models and mentors - work, learn and be inspired by some of the best talent in the software industry;

• a commitment to sustainability - with initiatives such as our Act4Good program, a way for everyone at Unit4 to come together and engage in actions that benefit society and the planet;

• a safe and inclusive working environment – supported by our Employee Resource Groups, which are open to all and include Women at Unit4, Pride at Unit4, Mental Health and Access at Unit4, and People of Color at Unit4.



This role may require security clearance required for customer projects and access to sensitive (customer) data. That means that after you have accepted our offer, we could ask for background checks. Subject to applicable local laws, such security checks may require disclosure of personal information including criminal record declaration, right to work, personal identification and work history. No worries though – we'll handle it according to local privacy laws and keep your info safe. Questions? Feel free to reach out!

Title: Junior NLP Engineer (Artificial Intelligence)
Description:
The field of artificial intelligence is rapidly advancing and transforming industries across the globe. At TransPerfect, we are embracing this technological wave by integrating AI innovations into our processes. As a part of our Artificial Intelligence team (AI team), the Junior NLP Engineer will learn and collaborate with specialists in technologies such as Natural Language Processing (NLP) and contribute to projects that align with our customer-focused objectives.

The Junior NLP Engineer will support the enhancement of cutting-edge NLP technologies with an emphasis on supporting translation, multilingual content generation, and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) systems. This role involves understanding and assisting in the development, design, and implementation of NLP-related software products. The Junior Engineer will work closely with team members and Product Managers (PdM) to ensure project alignment with company goals, coordinate with the Quality Assurance team (QA team) during development phases, and assist the Support team with troubleshooting and bug resolution.

DESCRIPTION

Actively participate in projects involving NLP technologies and support their integration into business applications.
Assist in the analysis, design, development, maintenance, and support of AI-driven applications, web services, and APIs focused on NLP.
Collaborate on projects related to machine translation, summarization, and natural language generation to meet key business objectives.
Assist in gathering, curating, and organizing data crucial to building robust NLP technologies, using publicly available datasets when necessary.
Support the proposal and implementation of NLP solutions to address complex business requirements.
Contribute to the development of multilingual content generation and RAG systems under the guidance of senior engineers.
Write and implement clean code while helping maintain and optimize existing systems, focusing on bug fixes and minor patches.
Document code and processes clearly for the benefit of the AI team.
Continuously seek out process improvements and suggest enhancements.




REQUIRED SKILLS

Fundamental programming skills with exposure to both Front-end and Back-end development.
Basic knowledge of programming languages such as Python, with an interest in further developing these skills for NLP tasks.
Familiarity with AI and NLP frameworks or tools like TensorFlow or PyTorch is a bonus.
A strong willingness to learn about LLMs and experience in any related projects is advantageous.
Problem-solving skills and an interest in creative approaches to AI challenges.
Ability to learn and adapt quickly to new technologies in AI and NLP.
Analytical thinking and the ability to work independently as well as in dynamic teams.
Good communication skills to collaborate effectively within the team.
Attention to detail and a commitment to quality, with a basic understanding of writing unit tests.




REQUIRED EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent experience) in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, or a related field.
Interest or experience in software development, with a focus on AI/ML and NLP is preferred.
Exposure to full software development life cycle practices, including coding standards and code reviews.
Experience working with APIs and basic knowledge of databases.
A basic understanding of product development and a willingness to participate in product discussions.




DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

A strong interest in natural language processing and machine learning practices.
Experience with LLM applications for translation or content generation is a plus.
Interest in full-stack development is beneficial.
Experience or interest in working within collaborative team settings on AI projects.
Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., GIT) is desirable.
Experience or interest in the localization or language services industry is advantageous.







By applying, I confirm I have read and accept TransPerfect's Privacy Policy: https://www.transperfect.com/about/data-privacy-recruiting.

Title: Data Scientist - Digital Marketing
Description:
Company Description

AUTODOC is the largest and fastest-growing auto parts e-commerce platform in Europe. Present across 27 countries with over 5,500 employees, AUTODOC generated revenue of over €1.5 billion in 2024, supplying more than 8.4 million active customers with its 6.6 million vehicle parts and accessories for car, truck, and motorcycle brands.

Curious minds, adventurous experts and tech-savvy professionals - one team, one billion euros revenue. Catch the ride!

Job Description

Responsibilities


Develop statistical and machine learning models to assess and optimize the effectiveness of marketing campaigns.
Analyze and interpret data to identify potential improvements in marketing strategies.
Apply uplift modeling methods to target specific customer groups to maximize ROI.
Collaborate with marketing and sales departments to understand business goals and translate them into analytical tasks.
Prepare and present reports on analysis results and recommendations for marketing strategy enhancements.
Evaluate and continuously improve analytics and modeling methodologies in line with the latest trends in Data Science.
Participate in the development and implementation of systems and tools to automate analytical processes.



Requirements


Over 2 years of experience in Data Science, with a focus on uplift modeling and causal effect analysis.
Deep knowledge and practical experience with Python and data analysis libraries (Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn), as well as specialized libraries for causal analysis, for example CausalML or others.
Understanding of A/B testing principles, including planning, conducting, and analyzing test results.
Knowledge of SQL and experience with databases, including ClickHouse, for effective data extraction and processing.



Nice to have


Knowledge and experience with Apache Spark and Apache Airflow for processing large data volumes and workflow automation.
Experience with cloud platforms, particularly Google Cloud Platform, for scaling and managing analytical solutions.
Familiarity with CI/CD principles, experience with model versioning, and understanding of MLOps fundamentals.
Bachelor's or higher degree in Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics or a related field.
Strong communication skills and the ability to effectively interact with both technical specialists and business stakeholders.



What do we offer?


Competitive salaries based on your professional experience
Annual vacation of 22 working days and 1 additional day off on your birthday
Meals Allowance
Healthcare Insurance
Mental Wellbeing Program- providing you and your immediate family members with free and confidential mental and physical health support services for a wide range of personal and work-related issues.
AUTODOC Corporate Discount
Opportunities for advancement, further trainings (over 650 courses on soft and hard skills on our e-learning platform) and coaching
Free English and German language classes
Referral Program with attractive incentives
Flexible working hours and hybrid work
Fast growing international company with stable employment



Join us today and let’s create a success story together!

Title: Data Scientist II - Performance Marketing
Description:
We believe that we are better together, and at Tripadvisor we welcome you for who you are. Our workplace is for everyone, as is our people powered platform. At Tripadvisor, we want you to bring your unique identities, abilities, and experiences, so we can collectively revolutionize travel and together find the good out there.

The Tripadvisor Data Science/Machine Learning Team is looking for an experienced individual to join a dynamic and fast-paced team to help support our Performance Marketing efforts. As an Data Scientist II, you will apply your modeling skills to a wide variety of problem spaces including, but not limited to bidding for online advertising, customer modeling, experimental design, revenue optimization, attribution, recommendations. You will have access to the newest development tools and huge data sets. You will deploy your solutions online and be able to observe the impact of your work in real time as you help the company grow.

We are looking for someone who is independent, curious, and motivated, who likes discussing ideas and will bring something new to the table. You will be working in a diverse environment where you’ll collaborate with a broad multidisciplinary team of data scientists, analysts, software engineers, and product managers. You’ll be encouraged to take ownership of your projects and to find new opportunities and problems where machine learning could be applied to improve the business.

Location: Please note, this position will be either office, hybrid or remote-based within Portugal.

About Data Science At Tripadvisor

Tripadvisor is the web's leading travel information site. At Tripadvisor, the DS/ML Team creates systems that influence the travel decisions of millions of people per day. We apply cutting edge machine learning techniques to a wide variety of areas, including recommenders, online advertising, vision, text processing, and natural language processing. To ensure continued success, Tripadvisor promotes a culture of personal development, including social activities, journal clubs, memberships in online learning resources, and participation in industry conferences. Have a great time while shaping the future of travel!

What You'll Do


Use machine learning models to solve a variety of core business problems across performance marketing.
Seek out new opportunities to apply data science and machine learning in the performance marketing space across all channels (e.g., Web, email, paid marketing)
Automate ETL pipelines
Prototype, evaluate, deploy and maintain new models in production
Design AB tests and analyze their results
Discover new ways to analyze and interpret the data
Communicate progress and interpretation of experimental results to technical and business stakeholders


Skills & Experience


PhD or Masters in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, or related field preferred (or masters with 2+ years of practical experience)
Knowledge of AB test design and analysis
Strong background in machine learning and statistics
Solid foundation on data structures and algorithms
Proficiency in Python for numerical/statistical programming (our group relies heavily on Numpy/Pandas/Scikit-learn)
Ability to interpret and write complex SQL queries
Experience with big data technologies, such as Hive and Spark
Track record of leading the deployment and maintenance of models


We strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you need a reasonable accommodation during the application or the recruiting process, please make sure to reach out to your individual recruiter or our team at recruitment@tripadvisor.com

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
HTML:
Are you our new Machine Learning Engineer specialising in machine learning and data pipelines? 🚀


Ready to leverage your ML expertise in a fast-growing HR & payroll tech scale-up? We're looking for an experienced ML Engineer to join our team in Lisbon. In this role, you'll drive the development of data-driven models to make our company ambition of a 100% Self Driving Payroll reality or a bit closer to reality. Excited to transform complex data into powerful insights that drive business decisions? Keep reading!


What can you expect of this role?

As a ML Engineer, you’ll play a pivotal part in building advanced machine learning solutions. Ranging from salary benchmarking and predictive analytics to anomaly detection, all leveraging our extensive payroll data. Your work will help drive Nmbrs toward our vision of a self-driving payroll application.


About Nmbrs:

We're a fast-growing scale-up building innovative HR & payroll technology. With 140+ colleagues in Amsterdam, Lisbon, and Stockholm, we do things differently. No traditional managers, a 4-day workweek, and the freedom to make an impact.


You will be successful in this role if you:

  • Are proficient in Python for machine learning development and scripting;
  • Have strong understanding of supervised learning fundamentals (experience with regression and classification algorithms like Random Forest, Gradient Boosting, and Neural Networks);
  • Have solid experience with ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, or scikit-learn);
  • Are experienced with data preprocessing and feature engineering using relevant libraries (Pandas, NumPy, NLTK);
  • Have experience with SQL Server for data querying and manipulation;
  • Have experience building and maintaining automated machine learning pipelines to increase efficiency and reliability;
  • Have experience in Azure Databricks for large-scale data processing and machine learning using Apache Spark and PySpark;
  • Have experience building and maintaining automated machine learning pipelines to increase efficiency and reliability;
  • Are fluent in English;
  • Have attention to detail.


Don't worry if you don't fit 100% of the requirements you can still apply if you feel you fit the majority of them :)


What’s in it for you?

  • We offer a gross annual salary 39k to 49k including holiday allowance, depending on experience;
  • The opportunity to develop with the newest AI tools like Devin AI, Claude (code), Cursor, Github Copilot or any other subscription you feel would boost your efficiency;
  • Nmbrs is a flat organisation in which you have the freedom and responsibility to do what you are good at and have an impact, in an agile working environment;
  • A personal coach who helps you with your personal and professional growth as well as a yearly budget for training and personal development;
  • We ensure a healthy work-life balance;
  • For us full-time means a 4-day workweek giving you one paid personal day to spend in a way that will benefit you the most;
  • We have a big and light office space close to the Cais do Sodré and all the floors of the office are accessible by elevator;
  • We work hybrid at Nmbrs;
  • We end the summer by bringing all offices together for an amazing event at a very secret location to spark togetherness and innovation and celebrate with each other;
  • Additionally we organise fun events of different themes every month, think: game nights, movie nights, ping pong tournaments, or pizza party (this events are voluntary);
  • Nmbrs offers the opportunity to go on an exchange to our offices in Amsterdam or Stockholm for up to 4 months.



Please note: We are not able to consider candidates who are not living and working in Portugal. At this moment we are not providing relocation sponsorships.


As part of our hiring process, we conduct a criminal background check for all candidates reaching the final stages. This helps us ensure a safe and secure environment for everyone.


At Nmbrs, we celebrate diversity and promote an inclusive environment in which our team members from all different backgrounds, ages, genders, or sexual orientations feel equally appreciated. To achieve this, we are committed to shaping a hiring process that provides everyone with an equal opportunity to get hired.

Title: Machine Learning Scientist II - Hotels
Description:
We believe that we are better together, and at Tripadvisor we welcome you for who you are. Our workplace is for everyone, as is our people powered platform. At Tripadvisor, we want you to bring your unique identities, abilities, and experiences, so we can collectively revolutionize travel and together find the good out there.

We are looking for an experienced scientist to join our Machine Learning team, focusing primarily on our Hotels Auction platform. Our Hotels business is one of the main online resources for travelers researching where to stay on their next trip, and the auction platform is a key component of the technology we use to connect those travelers with hotel operators and online travel agencies (OTAs). As a Machine Learning Scientist working in this space, you will have the opportunity to apply your modeling and engineering skills to a number of different areas, but with a particular focus on predictive modeling and auction dynamics. In this role, you will deploy your solutions online and be able to observe the impact of your work through continuous testing and iteration. In your day to day, you will collaborate with a broad multidisciplinary team, including other ML scientists, analysts, product managers, engineers, and partner facing teams to build ML powered solutions that help us understand how our partners value different hotels, and how different types of travelers prefer different types of hotels. You’ll be encouraged to take ownership of your projects and to find new opportunities and problems where machine learning could be applied to improve the business.

About Machine Learning At Tripadvisor

Tripadvisor is the web's leading travel information site. At Tripadvisor, the ML Team creates systems that influence the travel decisions of millions of people per day. We apply cutting edge machine learning techniques to a wide variety of areas, including recommenders, online advertising, vision, text processing, and natural language processing. To ensure continued success, Tripadvisor promotes a culture of personal development, including social activities, journal clubs, memberships in online learning resources, and participation in industry conferences. Have a great time while shaping the future of travel!

Location: Please note, this position will be either office, hybrid or remote-based within Portugal.

What You Will Be Doing


Participate in the design and deployment of machine learning models to solve a variety of core business problems across the Experiences business.
Seek out new opportunities to apply data science and machine learning in the Experiences space.
Prototype, evaluate, deploy and maintain new models in production
Design A/B tests and analyze their results
Communicate progress and interpretation of model output/performance to technical and business stakeholders
Participate in the determination of next steps for each project


What You Are Like


Team player
Loves to learn
Great communicator
Gets things done on time and on specification


Qualifications


PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, or related quantitative field (or Masters with 2+ years of practical experience).
Excellent communication skills for both technical and non-technical audiences.
Strong foundation in machine learning and statistics.
Solid foundation on data structures and algorithms.
Proficiency in Python.
Experience with sort and recommendation modeling a plus.
Experience working with real-world data strongly preferred.
Previous industry experience a plus.


We strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you need a reasonable accommodation during the application or the recruiting process, please make sure to reach out to your individual recruiter or our team at recruitment@tripadvisor.com

Title: Machine Learning Software Engineer
HTML:
We are Kaizen Gaming

Kaizen Gaming, the team powering Betano, is one of the biggest GameTech companies in the world, operating in 19 markets. We always aim to leverage cutting-edge technology, providing the best experience to our millions of customers who trust us for their entertainment.

We are a diverse team of more than 2.700 Kaizeners, from 40+ nationalities spreading across 3 continents. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace. We welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds, regardless of race, gender, religion, sexual orientation, or age.

Our #oneteam is proud to be among the Best Workplaces in Europe and certified Great Place to Work across our offices. Here, there’ll be no average day for you. Ready to Press Play on Potential?

Let's start with the role

At Kaizen, we aim to leverage the capabilities offered by modern AI algorithms to continuously improve our product and business. Kaizen’s AI department consists of product, platform and research teams and lies at the core of that mission. We develop AI products for various applications, ranging from detection of fraudulent activity to personalized gaming recommendations, and from AI-powered co-pilots to CRM optimizations.

We build our teams to be self-driven, autonomous and cross-functional. Within these teams, you will have the opportunity to work with Data Scientists, Machine Learning Engineers, Data Engineers, Data Analysts, Product Owners and Agile Delivery Leads.

As a Machine Learning Software Engineer, you will focus on delivering robust and scalable Machine Learning pipelines and you will support the operationalization of Machine Learning models.

As a Machine Learning Engineer your will:

  • Design, develop and maintain scalable model training and inference pipelines in a distributed production environment;
  • Design, develop and maintain microservices in Python that host and serve ML models on production;
  • Design, develop and maintain internal tools that enable CI/CD/CT, performant feature engineering, experiment tracking, data and model versioning.

What you’ll bring

  • Ηands-on experience in software development using Python on a production environment;
  • Good understanding of:
    • Software system design;
    • The ML project lifecycle;
    • MLOps concepts and tools such as MLflow or Kubeflow;
    • ML algorithms and models.
  • Experience with cloud providers like Microsoft Azure or AWS;
  • Experience with PySpark and Databricks.
Kaizen Gaming Perks

  • 🕑 Hybrid model of working;
  • 🏃 A buddy will support you with your onboarding;
  • 💸 Competitive salary package and bonus scheme;
  • 👩‍⚕️ Health and life insurance for you and your family;
  • 💰 Monthly meal allowance
  • ⭐ Developmental 360° feedback framework;
  • 📚 Unlimited access to Udemy & continuous training
  • 🚗 Commuting allowance



Recruitment Privacy Notice

Regarding the data you share with us, you may find and read our recruitment privacy notice here.

We are an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace. We welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds, regardless of race, gender, religion, sexual orientation,or age.

Title: Machine Learning Scientist II (Moderation & Fraud)
Description:
We believe that we are better together, and at Tripadvisor we welcome you for who you are. Our workplace is for everyone, as is our people powered platform. At Tripadvisor, we want you to bring your unique identities, abilities, and experiences, so we can collectively revolutionize travel and together find the good out there.




At Tripadvisor, we never stop learning. This is true both individually and as a company, where constant experimentation helps us to understand how we can continue to grow and improve the user experience for our 500 million unique monthly visitors worldwide. Data-driven decision making is at the core of what we do.




Location: Please note, this position will be either office, hybrid or remote-based within Portugal.




About Machine Learning at Tripadvisor




Tripadvisor is the web's leading travel information site. At Tripadvisor, the Machine Learning Team creates systems that influence the travel decisions of millions of people per day. It applies cutting edge machine learning techniques to a wide variety of areas such as personalization, recommenders, computer vision, and natural language processing (NLP). To ensure continued success, Tripadvisor promotes a culture of personal development, including social activities, journal clubs, memberships in online learning resources, and participation in industry conferences. Have a great time while shaping the future of travel!




What You Will Be Doing




As a Machine Learning Scientist specializing in content moderation and fraud detection, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our content integrity and user experience at Tripadvisor. You will be responsible for designing and implementing advanced machine learning models aimed at assessing the fairness, reliability, and validity of user-generated content. Your work will directly impact how travelers interact with our platform, ensuring they receive high quality, trustworthy information and recommendations.




You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including content specialists/analysts, software engineers, and product managers, to translate complex data into actionable insights. Your insights will guide the development of robust systems that enhance user trust and satisfaction. We seek someone with a deep understanding of machine learning principles, strong analytical skills, and a passion for creating equitable and impactful solutions.




Skills & Experience





Advanced degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, or a related field.


Strong background in machine learning and statistics.


Solid foundation on data structures and algorithms.


Ability to write complex SQL queries. Experience with Snowflake is a bonus.


Proficiency in Python.


At least 2 years of relevant, practical experience.


Experience with MLOps processes, platforms and tools.


[Bonus] Experience with fraud detection and content moderation.


[Bonus] Experience with LLMs and GAI models, including prompt engineering techniques such as N-shot prompting, Chain of Thought (CoT) prompting and Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG).


[Bonus] Experience with deep learning, modern NLP & machine vision techniques.





We strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates.

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Company you will be happy to grow with!

At InnoTech, it´s all about connecting people with business through technology.

We care about you, your happiness, and your well-being. We seek people who want to learn and further improve their skills with us – growth is part of our DNA, and that’s why we’re proud to be certified as a Great Place to Work and to be among the Top 50 Best Workplaces in Portugal! For us, sustainability is not just a word. Integrity and social responsibility lead our behavior.

We dare to be different, ambitious, dream big, and deliver value like no other! You will have the opportunity to work with top-level partners in the banking area, insurance, retail, telecommunications, financial services, and so much more!

We are 180+ InnoTechers, and we want your talent as a Data Scientist.

Your Mission Will Be

  • Design and experiment with machine learning and NLP models using both supervised and unsupervised techniques;
  • Collaborate in building data-driven products that enhance user experience and deliver business value;
  • Maintain and retrain models, while conducting statistical evaluations to ensure performance;
  • Support the development of data pipelines and APIs to deploy predictive models;
  • Stay current with breakthroughs in AI and NLP, proposing innovative approaches and creative solutions.

You Will Need

  • +5 years of experience as Data Scientist;
  • Strong experience in Python and major libraries;
  • Hands-on knowledge of cloud platforms like Azure, AWS, or GCP, along with Docker containerization;
  • Practical experience developing and maintaining RESTful or asynchronous APIs;
  • Fluent in Portuguese and English (other languages are a plus);
  • CPLP nationality or an EU work permit is required to facilitate employment.

Would Be Awesome If You Have

  • BSc or MSc in Computer Science/Engineering, Information Technology, or related fields.

With Us You Can Be a

  • TechThinker – people who want to re-imagine technology with us;
  • TechSolver – a strategic, resilient and little bit a puzzle love;
  • InnoMinder – inhale innovation, exhale digital transformation;
  • InnoTecher – no words needed. Just happiness, talent and all the above!

Are you convinced? See it for yourself.

Join our Top-Notch Team!

Title: Senior Data Scientist – Operations Research | Lisbon (Hybrid)
Description:
Workster is partnering with a global leader in mobility solutions to find a Senior Data Scientist – Operations Research to join their dynamic team in Lisbon.

If you’re passionate about optimizing pricing strategies and enjoy solving complex problems using

machine learning and mathematical modeling, this opportunity is for you!




Your Role

Revenue Management & Price Optimization: Design and deploy advanced dynamic pricing and bid price optimization systems.
Operations Research Modeling: Solve complex linear, nonlinear, and stochastic optimization problems.
Forecasting & Demand Modeling: Use time series and ML techniques to predict customer demand and willingness to pay.
Algorithm Development: Build scalable algorithms and ensure seamless integration with production environments.
Collaboration: Work cross-functionally with product managers, engineers, and data teams.
Thought Leadership: Stay ahead of trends, share insights, and mentor junior data scientists.




Your Qualifications

5+ years of experience in data science/operations research (ideally in travel, airline, or car rental industries).
Strong background in revenue management and pricing systems.
Expertise in mathematical optimization and solvers.
Skilled in demand forecasting and regression-based ML.
Advanced Python programming and version control experience.
Analytical thinker with strong business translation skills.
Master's degree (or higher) in OR, Applied Math, or related field (preferred).




The Offer

Time Off: 28 vacation days + birthday off + 1 volunteer day
Work-Life Balance: Hybrid model, flexible hours, no dress code
Employee Benefits: rent/share/ride discounts + partner perks
Growth: Access to training, dev talks & international conferences
Health Insurance: Private medical coverage
Relocation Support: Temporary accommodation for 4 weeks
Location: Lisbon, Portugal
Language: English
Start Date: ASAP




📩 Interested? Let’s talk!




Send your CV to: paula.skalecka@workster.jobs




Have questions? Feel free to reach out – we’re happy to help!

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We are hiring a Machine Learning Architect to join a leading gaming company, where innovation meets scale.

As a senior ML expert, you’ll play a critical role in optimising performance and setting up model monitoring frameworks to ensure robust AI-driven gaming experiences.




What You’ll Do:

Architect scalable ML solutions for high-performance gaming systems
Design and implement model monitoring frameworks to track model drift, performance, and reliability
Optimise model performance across production environments
Collaborate with Data Engineering and DevOps teams for seamless deployment and lifecycle management
Serve as a technical lead, mentoring team members and driving best practices




Requirements:

✅ 5+ years of experience in Machine Learning and Architecture

✅ Strong expertise in Performance Optimization and Model Monitoring Setup

✅ Proficient with Databricks, Snowflake, and AWS SageMaker

✅ Excellent communication skills and fluency in English

✅ Proven ability to work cross-functionally in high-growth, fast-paced environments

Title: Data Scientist – Scoring Center (M/F)
Description:
Present in more than 30 countries, BNP Paribas Personal Finance leads the personal and consumer credit business. In some markets we are leaders, and we bet on innovation to open up new opportunities, in others we are a fast growing business. In all markets, we value relationships, knowledge sharing and responsible action

In practice, your day-to-day


As a Data Scientist in the Scoring Center team, you will undertake projects to build risk prediction models. Your main responsibilities will be:
As part of your modelling projects, you assess the needs expressed, define and propose the adapted deliverables and estimate their burden and time frame through an implementation plan that takes into account the challenges and constraints. You use statistical modelling methods (such as Logistic Regression, Random Forest, Gradient Boosting…), analyze and explain the results
You lead the project, keep track of the schedule and support the implementation and monitoring of the tools issued
As part of the monitoring and optimization of the BNP Paribas Personal Finance score models, you participate in the monitoring campaigns of the scores: generation and analysis of monitoring results, diagnosis and action plan
You are also responsible for conducting or analyzing statistical studies related to risk prediction models. If necessary, you take part in analytical support missions to the Group's international entities and in the processing of audit recommendations relating to the Basel regulatory project
In addition, you actively contribute to the transversal missions of the Scoring Center: technological and methodological watch, regulatory watch, training, analytical support for the Group's international entities

The Mission is important, but so is the Team and the workplace!


Welcome to BNP Paribas Personal Finance, where you will integrate the Analytics Hub, an innovative, international and creative team. Our working language is English
You will be in the Scoring Center teams that are made up of 30 Data Scientists that will work with you. The team in Lisbon is new and everyone is growing together. You'll be surrounded by colleagues working in the same field as you, sharing ideas and experiences
We are prepared to welcome you with an initial onboarding plan, with on-the-job training, online learning and networking opportunities


What do we have to offer you?


This is a very important topic that we will address together, taking into account your training and experience.


Are you the one we are looking for?


Do you have a Degree in Data Science, Mathematics or Statistics?
Do you have a scientific background and at least 3 years of experience in a statistical or risk environment, preferably modelling in banking or insurance environment?"
Do you have good skills in Python?
Are you proficient in modelling environment or data lab and have a strong knowledge of the main data science libraries?
Do you have experience in machine models industrialization?
Are you able to work on several projects in parallel and are acknowledge for your accuracy?
Are you fluent in oral and written English?
If you recognize yourself in this description, and have a lot of enthusiasm, energy and motivation, then you are the one we are looking for!
We look forward to your application!


Our commitments


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer that is proud to provide equal employment opportunities to all job seekers. As a socially responsible company, we incorporate the principles of Diversity and Inclusion in our values and practices
To achieve all our goals, we intend to attract, develop, and retain different profiles, assuming diversity as an enabler and differentiator of innovation, fundamental in our organization


What makes us proud as reference employer?


Top Employer Portugal and Top Employer Europe certification, for the seventh consecutive year
92% of our employees identify BNP Paribas as a company with "an inclusive management that supports all kinds of differences (age, origins, sexual orientation ...)"
93% of employees identify with and benefit from the "Smart Working" policy, feeling comfortable in a hybrid work environment, and with the digital tools and workspaces available
71% of our customers are promoters of our brand

  • Do you have good skills in Python?
  • Are you proficient in modelling environment or data lab and have a strong knowledge of the main data science libraries?
  • Do you have experience in machine models industrialization?
  • Are you able to work on several projects in parallel and are acknowledge for your accuracy?
  • Are you fluent in oral and written English?
  • If you recognize yourself in this description, and have a lot of enthusiasm, energy and motivation, then you are the one we are looking for!
  • We look forward to your application!

Our commitments

  • BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer that is proud to provide equal employment opportunities to all job seekers. As a socially responsible company, we incorporate the principles of Diversity and Inclusion in our values and practices
  • To achieve all our goals, we intend to attract, develop, and retain different profiles, assuming diversity as an enabler and differentiator of innovation, fundamental in our organization

What makes us proud as reference employer?

  • Top Employer Portugal and Top Employer Europe certification, for the seventh consecutive year
  • 92% of our employees identify BNP Paribas as a company with "an inclusive management that supports all kinds of differences (age, origins, sexual orientation ...)"
  • 93% of employees identify with and benefit from the "Smart Working" policy, feeling comfortable in a hybrid work environment, and with the digital tools and workspaces available
  • 71% of our customers are promoters of our brand

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
M/F







DESAFIO:

Procuramos um Data Scientist com experiência, espírito crítico e gosto no contacto com o negócio para integrar a nossa equipa de Data Science. Trabalhamos em projetos para as diferentes áreas da empresa, transformando dados em insights que orientam decisões estratégicas.







O QUE ESPERAMOS DE TI:




Colaboração com as equipas de negócio para entender os desafios e transformar problemas em projetos data-driven.
Capacidade de compreender problemas de negócio, estruturá-los e traduzi-los para soluções técnicas.
Proatividade e autonomia para identificar oportunidades e propor melhorias.
Capacidade para estruturar projetos de forma eficaz, definindo as diferentes fases, tarefas e objetivos em cada etapa, mantendo sempre uma visão estratégica - big picture do projeto.
Gosto pela análise de tendências e utilização de dados para suporte à tomada de decisão.
Habilidade para desenvolver e otimizar soluções baseadas em inferência estatística, machine learning ou algoritmos avançados de IA.
Comunicação clara para apresentar resultados e recomendações às partes interessadas.







PERFIL:

Licenciatura/Mestrado em Engenharia, Data Science, Data Analytics, Ciências da Computação, Matemática, Estatística ou áreas relacionadas.
Experiência comprovada como Data Scientist ou Senior Data Analyst.
Pensamento crítico e abordagem orientada à resolução de problemas (problem-solver).
Sólidos conhecimentos de programação em Python e linguagens de consulta de dados como SQL.
Experiência em trabalho com metodologias Agile, incluindo o uso de repositórios de dados e ferramentas de versionamento para colaboração e gestão de projetos.
Familiaridade com o processamento e análise de grandes volumes de dados.
Fortes capacidades de comunicação e apresentação, facilitando a interação com diferentes stakeholders.







VALORIZAMOS AINDA:

Experiência na utilização de ferramentas de Business Intelligence, como o Excel e PowerBI.
Experiência com plataformas de AutoML, como a Data Robot.
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We are looking for a ML Engineer to work closely with the ML Architect to develop on ML frameworks (TensorFlow, Scikit-Learn, Pytorch), Experimentation platform and tools.

This role has the responsabilities to:


Develop large-scale distributed machine learning systems that are scalable, performant, efficient, and reliable
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to help deploy/integrate machine learning models.
Liaise with the BUs for their ML needs and work on the cross-BU ML portfolio
Optimize feature extraction, transformation and selection.
Work with and manage
Feature Stores for reusability across ML pipelines
Ensure scalability, reliability, cost efficiency, and ease of use of the machine learning platform
Contribute to evaluating and adopting new technologies and tools to enhance our machine-learning capabilities



Requirements


3-5 years of experience as an ML Engineer preferably with a Gaming industry background
Experienced with ML frameworks (TensorFlow, Scikit-Learn, Pytorch)
Experienced with Model training, versioning and monitoring
Strong background in MLOps practices, including CI/CD, containerization (Docker), orchestration frameworks (Kubernetes, Airflow), model serving tools (AWS SageMaker, Databricks MLFlow), model observability frameworks, automation and feature stores



Benefits

The Things We Really Care About:


Health Insurance, because health comes first
Flexible working hours
Open holidays, take the time you need for yourself
Profit distribution for everyone
Mindera Annual Trip, Sports, and sharing groups to connect and have fun!
Training & conferences, create your own training plan
Child Care vouchers



Other good things:


Choose Laptop & Peripherals that best suit your needs
Hotspot with unlimited usage (PT), for work or Netflix ;)
We have amazing offices in Porto, Aveiro, and Coimbra if you want to physically connect with minders. Remote from Portugal is also an option. Remote from other Countries will depend on your current location and Projects
At the offices, we have a wide range of snacks to keep you fed and healthy
Partnerships with local businesses


Most of all you get to work with a bunch of great people, where the whole team owns the project together in a politics-free environment. Our culture reflects our lean and self-organization attitude. We encourage our colleagues to take risks, make decisions, work in a collaborative way and talk to everyone to enhance communication. Freedom and Responsibility go hand in hand, and we value commitment, feedback, and empathy.

About Mindera

At Mindera we use technology to build products we are proud of, with people we love.

Software Engineering Applications, including Web and Mobile, are at the core of what we do at Mindera.

We partner with our clients, to understand their products and deliver high-performance, resilient, and scalable software systems that create an impact on their users and businesses across the world.

You get to work with a bunch of great people, where the whole team owns the project together.

Our culture reflects our lean and self-management attitude. We encourage our colleagues to take risks, make decisions, work in a collaborative way and talk to everyone to enhance communication.

We are proud of our work and we love to learn all and everything while navigating through an Agile, Lean and collaborative environment.

Check out our Blog and our Handbook!

Our offices are located: Porto, Portugal | Aveiro, Portugal | Coimbra, Portugal | Leicester, UK | San Diego, USA | San Francisco, USA | Chennai, India | Bengaluru, India | Cluj-Napoca, Romania | Blumenau, Brazil

Title: Applied AI/ML Engineer
Description:
About Us

How did Web Summit become, in the words of Forbes, “the best tech conference on the planet”? Meaningful connections. Our tech events are unmissable because we make it easier for the right people to meet and connect. Everyone at Web Summit works towards this goal.

And we’re just getting started.

We’re always looking to build on the impact we have already made at Web Summit. In the coming years we’ll take Web Summit to new markets, promoting global connectivity, highlighting important issues and connecting global leaders – all while making a positive impact on the environment and communities we encounter.

To build a better company, we have to better ourselves. We do that by finding the most ambitious people to work with us.

We are seeking a versatile and innovative Applied AI/ML Engineer to lead the integration of Generative AI and machine learning into our product suite. This role is ideal for professionals who excel at transforming cutting-edge AI research into robust, user-centric applications.

Web Summits engineering team build in house software that powers all aspect of our attendees event experience, from native mobile applications, recommendation systems, and registration/tracking software to name a few.

What You Will Achieve


Design, develop, and deploy scalable machine learning models, with a focus on Generative AI applications such as LLMs, diffusion models, and transformers.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams—including product managers, data scientists, and software engineers—to integrate AI solutions seamlessly into products.
Implement and optimize data pipelines for training and inference processes.
Conduct rigorous testing and validation of models to ensure performance, reliability, and fairness.
Stay abreast of the latest advancements in AI/ML to inform technology choices and innovation strategies.


Skills And Abilities We Are Looking For


Proven experience in machine learning engineering, with a portfolio of deployed AI solutions.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, and familiarity with ML frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch.
Strong understanding of data structures, algorithms, and software architecture.
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure) and containerization tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.


Nice To Haves


Advanced degree (Master's or Ph.D.) in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field a plus but not essential.
Experience with prompt engineering and fine-tuning of large language models.
Familiarity with MLOps practices and tools for continuous integration and deployment of ML models.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.


Benefits And Perks


Hybrid-working model open to all employees.
Fully subsidised healthcare, dental, employee assistance programme (EAP) and more.
Pension contribution up to 6%(Irish based only)
A dedicated in-house L&D department, with access to workshops, online learning and resources to help you excel in your career development.
Company laptop, generous annual leave and flexible working arrangements.
Our very own Tramway Team, which drives community and morale-boosting events for employees to participate in.
Annual company get-togethers, charity days, and monthly wellbeing talks.
Wellness subsidy issued to all employees of €1000 per year


At Web Summit, we embrace diversity and inclusion. We want talent from all walks of life to help us on our journey to digitise the conference sector. Hiring decisions are made purely on experience, skills and the needs of the business.
Show more
